Dr. Seema Sakkara
FACULTY INFO
DEPARTMENT OF CHEMICAL ENGINEERING
Invited Talk
The Department regularly organizes Expert Lectures, inviting experienced and prominent experts to enrich the knowledge of our students on recent developments in industrial technology and research. Webinars are also a regular part of the department activities helping students to connect with professionals overseas as well as alumni pursuing higher education in reputed universities overseas.
Facilities
The class rooms are equipped with overhead projectors.
The laboratories are equipped with the state of the art equipment.
The department also houses a library with over 1000 books and copies on various courses, soft copies of various journals and project thesis being added regularly.
A dedicated research laboratory with advanced equipment’s like Gas Chromatography, Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry.
Research
Three of the faculty members are Doctorates from National Institute of Technology, Karnataka and Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Anantapur, while nine faculty members are pursuing PhD in core areas of research on waste management, Bio fuels, Nano Technology in photovoltaics and photo catalysis and fuels from plastics.
The department has ongoing projects funded by Vision Group of Science and Technology – VGST, Karnataka State Council of Science and Technology - KSCST and have successfully completed project on UKIERI-PTS on Health and Safety funded by British Council and MODROBS, funded by AICTE, DRDO, Indian Institute of Chemical Engineers – IIChE.
To inculcate research interest, students right from their second year of the programme are also involved in research activities of the department.
Department News
The department organizes national level Technical symposium – CHEMOVATION, a platform that brings students from various states to showcase their projects and expert lectures by professionals from industries and researchers.
The department has constituted an association called Chemical Engineering Association – ChEA, headed by a senior faculty and run by student representatives, aimed to actively promote all round development of students. ChEA provides a platform for students to plan, organize and host many technical and non-technical events.
Chemical Day, is one such event which students look eagerly to organize activities like technical paper and poster presentations, quiz, modeling, cultural and sports etc. and also actively participate to show case their talents.
Department Highlights
Students have constantly bagged top ranks in VTU and have also won BEST STUDENT awards at state level.
Scholarships are awarded to deserving students to aid their academics.
The department has projects funded by various National and State funding agencies
Students participate in various National conferences to show case their projects and win accolades for their work.
Student’s talents in sports and cultural are identified and encouraged.
Department Publications
Faculty publish their research work in various reputed National and International journals.
Students participate in conferences, seminars and are publishing their work in journals
Department brings out an annual newsletter,- “CATALICA”, publishing the faculty and students’ achievements, activities of department, University Ranks bagged by students and articles by faculty and students.
Department brings out souvenirs during Chemovation, national level symposium.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS
Students have been placed in MNC companies like Wood Group Kenny India Pvt ltd,
Mangalore Chemicals and fertilizers ltd, Cipla ltd, Enventure Engineering, Biocon, Techniche Engineering Pvt Ltd, Tek systems, Shell India Markets Pvt Ltd.
View More

Civil Engineering
Home

Civil Engineering
Admission Enquiry
"National Seminar 2023”
"About the Department ”
"Media Coverage ”
Civi Tech
Dr H. K. Ramaraju was INVITed TO BE A POSTER JUDGE AT THE SINGAPORE INTERNATIONAL WATER WEEK (SIWW) WATER CONVENTION 2022
Department of Civil Engineering has got Rs.1,00,000/- grant from SCIENCE & ENGINEERING RESEARCH BOARD (SERB) for Seminar Symposia under the titled "Sustainable Advanced Wastewater treatment Technologies” by Prof B T Shivendra and Mr. Vinay A
Department of Civil Engineering has got Rs.19,95,686/- grant in aid from Kudremukh Iron Ore Company Limited for Research and Development on "Synthesis of Kudremukh Iron Ore Mine Tailings based Geopolymer Aggregate using Fly Ash as Precursor in Construction Industry" by Dr. H K Ramaraju and Mr. Abhinandan
ENGINEER'S DAY
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO 1 :
Take up career in sustainableinfrastructure development for the benefit of society.
PEO 2 :
Pursue higher education with the mindset of continuous up gradation.
PEO 3 :
Work with different soft skills to meet the industrial needs.
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
PSO 1
:Analysis and Design of structures, transportation systems, water resource management and environmental aspects.
PSO 2
: Develop sufficient knowledge to provide sustainable environment in the respective field of study.
PSO 3
: Apply the construction strategies for socio-economic development
Vision
Emerge into a center of excellence providing globally competent engineers oriented towards research, innovation and sustainable development of the society.
Mission
Disseminate quality education and provide a research environment.
Foster experimental and professional skills.
Inculcate the importance of ethics and sustainability.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
Civil Engineering – known as Mother of all Engineering Branches is a broad discipline that unifies the specialization like Environmental Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, Hydraulics and Water Resources Engineering, Construction Materials and Management, Structural Engineering, Transportation Engineering, Planning & Architecture.
Dr. Ramaraju H K
Vice-Principal,
Professor & Head of the Department.
E-mail
:
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Phone
: +91-80-42161619

NEWS & EVENTS
Glacier Preservation
The Institution of Water Engineers, Karnataka, in collaboration with the Indian Water Works Association (IWWA), Bengaluru Centre, organized a debate competition on the theme "Glacier Preservation" on 22nd March 2025, in celebration of World Water Day at Jalaseva Bhavan, BTM Layout, Bangalore.
Higher Education Overseas
Education plays a pivotal role in shaping the future of individuals and societies. With the increasing interconnectivity of the world, global education systems are evolving to provide enhanced opportunities for students and professionals.
Water & Sanitation: Health, Environment and Afforestation
Organised by Department of Civil Engineering, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE), Shavige Malleshwara Hills, Kumaraswamy Layout, Bangalore-560111 and Indian Water Works Association (IWWA), Youth Forum Bangalore at Melukote, Pandavapura Taluk, Mandya District.
Innovation in Sustainable and Digital Construction Practices
1st International Conference on Innovation in Sustainable and Digital Construction Practices (ISDCP 2025) on 23rd-25th January 2025.

FACULTY INFO
CIVIL DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
Mr. Venkatesh, who is an expert and certified trainer in the field of CAD/CAM/CAE delivered the technical talk addressing the second and third year B.E Civil engineering students.
Facilities
Department has well equipped laboratories with UPS Support. Department has library of 120 sq feet containing around 1000+ books with seating capacity of 10.
Research
Science and Engineering Research Board has sanctioned Rs. 1,00,000/- for the conduction of Seminar Symposia on
"Use of solar energy as a water pumping system for irrigation Purpose"
and Indian Space Research Organisation has sanctioned Rs.50,000/- for conducting Seminar Symposia on
"Role of GIS/GPS in integrated water resources management."
Department News
The Department of Civil Engineering, DSCE Bangalore-78 , Under Community Services Committee is organizing Environmental Awareness Programme & Swachh Bharath Abhiyan.
Department Highlights
Department of Civil Engineering congratulates for Dev Anand Thakur bearing USN 1DS14CV030 for securing 7th Rank in Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) for 18th Annual Convocation.
PUBLICATIONS
Analytical Study of Strengthening of RCC Beam Openings by BFRP Composites using ABAQUS.

Dayananda Sagar Institutions has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students...
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Admission Enquiry
PO
Program Outcomes
PO1: Engineering Knowledge:
Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, computing, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialization as specified in
WK1 to WK4
respectively to develop to the solution of complex engineering problems.
PO2: Problem Analysis:
Identify, formulate, review research literature and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions with consideration for sustainable development.
(WK1 to WK4)
PO3: Design/Development of Solutions:
Design creative solutions for complex engineering problems and design/develop systems/components/processes to meet identified needs with consideration for the public health and safety, whole-life cost, net zero carbon, culture, society and environment as required.
(WK5)
PO4: Conduct Investigations of Complex Problems:
Conduct investigations of complex engineering problems using research-based knowledge including design of experiments, modelling, analysis & interpretation of data to provide valid conclusions.
(WK8)
.
PO5: Engineering Tool Usage:
Create, select and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern engineering & IT tools, including prediction and modelling recognizing their limitations to solve complex engineering problems.
(WK2 and WK6)
PO6: The Engineer and The World:
Analyze and evaluate societal and environmental aspects while solving complex engineering problems for its impact on sustainability with reference to economy, health, safety, legal framework, culture and environment.
(WK1, WK5, and WK7)
.
PO7: Ethics:
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics, human values, diversity and inclusion; adhere to national & international laws.
(WK9)
PO8: Individual and Collaborative Team work:
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse/multi-disciplinary teams.
PO9: Communication:
Communicate effectively and inclusively within the engineering community and society at large, such s being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations considering cultural, language, and learning differences.
PO10: Project Management and Finance:
Apply knowledge and understanding of engineering management principles and economic decision-making and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, and to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
PO11: Life-Long Learning:
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability for i) independent and life-long learning ii) adaptability to new and emerging technologies and iii) critical thinking in the broadest context of technological change.
(WK8)
.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO 1
:Graduates will have the ability to apply the knowledge of Electrical & Electronics Engineering to excel in their career path.
PEO 2
:Graduates will be confident to work in flexible and diverse professional fields.
PEO 3
:Graduates will have commitment and awareness to thrive in their ethical and social responsibilities
PEO 4
:Graduates will have the ability to pursue higher education, engage in research and development, benefit from quality education and state-of-the-art facilities, and commit to lifelong learning processes.
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
PSO-1:
The students will be able to apply the knowledge of mathematics, and applied science principles to solve diverse problems in the field of Power systems and Control of Electric Drives catering to Industrial, Research, Service and allied areas.
PSO-2:
The students would be competent in identifying, analyzing and exhibiting the skills in providing solutions to problems related to control electronic systems using various modern tools.
PSO-3:
The students will be able to demonstrate proficiency in design and development of different electrical and electronics system as per specified standards.
TLP
Teaching,Learning Process at EEE Department
Videos Of Pactical Lab Experiments
The department of EEE is has a bank of videos related to lab experiments which can be viewed by the students to get more acquainted with the experiments. The labs are also equipped with additional experiments apart from the curriculum for knowledge enhancement of students.
Sample Videos
1.) LD_LAB- BOOLEAN_EXPRESSION
2.)CS LAB-SYNCHRO PAIR_ CHARS
3.)AEC _LAB_CLAMPER CIRCUIT
4.)MC_LAB_WAVEFORMGEN_DAC
5.)HV_LAB_FUSE CHARS
6.) DCM_LAB_SLIPTEST
7.) CSM_LAB_TWO WATTMETER
8.) PE_LAB_FULLWAVE_RECTIFIER
9.) TIM_LAB-SUMPNERTEST
10.) PSS_LAB_SWING CURVE
Online & Offline Technical Quizzes
The department of EEE is continually engaged in conducting technical quizzes for students as an alternative method to assess the learning abilities of its students
Skill Enhancement Course Modules
The department of EEE has developed course modules and material related to power electronics, Opamps& linear ICs and Logic design using simulation tools for the students to have hands on experience on the related concepts.
Mini Project & Poster Presentation
The faculty of the department encourages and guides the students in developing mini projects related to their interested topics in the curriculum. The students can also carry out poster presentation on their choice of technical topics.
Physical Demonstration and Explanation of Electrical Apparatus
The department of EEE is keen in enhancing the student’s awareness towards practical concepts of the program and in this regard efforts are taken by the faculty to demonstrate and explain the significance of various electrical apparatus used in day today life.
Guidelines for Electrical Drawing and Layout Preparation
The students are made to acquaint with the importance of electrical drawings and electrical layouts using software tools.
Lab-View Based Visual Learning of Basic Electrical Engineering Concepts
The students of EEE Dept. are facilitated in learning the basic electrical engineering concepts in a visualized way using lab view based animations.
NPTEL Videos, Lecture Videos & PPTS
The faculty of the department has adopted the practice of using presentation slides and videos wherever necessary in their course deliverable. The department library is also equipped with a bank of NPTEL lecture videos related to the program for the access of students.
WK
Knowledge and Attitude Profile
WK1:
A systematic, theory-based understanding of the natural sciences applicable to the discipline and awareness of relevant social sciences.
WK2:
Conceptually-based mathematics, numerical analysis, data analysis, statistics and formal aspects of computer and information science to support detailed analysis and modelling applicable to the discipline.
WK3:
A systematic, theory-based formulation of engineering fundamentals required in the engineering discipline.
WK4:
Engineering specialist knowledge that provides theoretical frameworks and bodies of knowledge for the accepted practice areas in the engineering discipline; much is at the forefront of the discipline.
WK5:
Knowledge, including efficient resource use, environmental impacts, whole-life cost, reuse of resources, net zero carbon, and similar concepts, that supports engineering design and operations in a practice area.
WK6:
Knowledge of engineering practice (technology) in the practice areas in the engineering discipline.
WK7:
Knowledge of the role of engineering in society and identified issues in engineering practice in the discipline, such as the professional responsibility of an engineer to public safety and sustainable development.
WK8:
Engagement with selected knowledge in the current research literature of the discipline, awareness of the power of critical thinking and creative approaches to evaluate emerging issues.
WK9:
Ethics, inclusive behavior and conduct. Knowledge of professional ethics, responsibilities, and norms of engineering practice. Awareness of the need for diversity by reason of ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability etc. with mutual understanding and respect, and of inclusive attitudes.
Vision
To meet the challenging needs of society by innovation, problem solving and to develop an exciting and supportive learning environment that transforms our students and inspires them to make a real difference in their career and society.
Mission
To provide an enduring learning environment that facilitates the students to pursue their higher education.
To train students with diverse skills to work professionally in various fields through innovative teaching and learning processes, imparting the highest standards of quality education and providing state-of-the-art facilities while nurturing research and development.
To provide value based and behavioural training programs that help students in developing their overall professional competence and social awareness.
From the HOD's Desk:
Greetings and welcome to the Electrical and Electronics Engineering (EEE) Department at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering in Bangalore. As the Head of the Department, I am proud to lead a community where education and innovation go hand in hand and where we strive to provide a transformative learning experience that is both challenging and supportive. The EEE Department at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering was established in 1979 and has since reached numerous achievements, including (i) receiving accreditation from the National Board of Accreditation (NBA) in New Delhi four times, (ii) holding a permanent affiliation with Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU), etc.
Dr. Premkumar M
Professor and Head,
Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering
E-mail
:

: +91-80-42161743

NEWS & EVENTS
Intelligent and Sustainable Power and Energy Systems
The Department of EEE is organizing a 3rd International Conference on "Intelligent and Sustainable Power and Energy Systems (ISPES 2025)" from 18 - 19 December 2025.
FDP on "Applications of AI Techniques in Modern Power and Energy Systems"
The Department of EEE is organizing a one week Faculty Development Program on “Applications of AI Techniques in Modern Power and Energy systems” from 21st to 26th of August 2025.
Virtual Prototyping and Simulation of Power Electronic Converters for Electric Vehicle and Renewable Energy Systems
The Department of EEE is organizing a webinar series on “Virtual Prototyping and Simulation of Power Electronic Converters for Electric Vehicle and Renewable Energy Systems” from 18th to 22nd of August 2025.

EEE DEPARTMENT
Centre of Excellence
The Department of EEE, DSCE inaugurated a lab for the "EV Center of Excellence” on 12th June 2025. The CoE lab focuses on providing hands-on exposure to Electric Vehicle technologies.
Facilities
Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department has class rooms, tutorial rooms and staff rooms with all equipped with projectors.
Research Center
The Electrical and Electronics Engineering (EEE) Department has been recognized as a Research and Development Centre by VTU since 2012. We are proud to facilitate a comprehensive Doctoral program (PhD) and M.Sc. (Engineering) by research.
Department News
The Department of EEE has continuously organizing activities like Workshops, Seminars, and etc. on various topics which are relative to academics and as per industry needs for the benefit of the students and faculties.
Department Highlights
Dr.M.Premkumar,AssociateProfessor,dept. of E&EE, DSCE, has participated in a National Workshop on “Advanced Technologies for Electrical Engineering” organized by the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Sri Sivasubramanian Nadar College of Engineering, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India, from 04-02-2022 to 05-02-2022.
Department Publications
Dr.P.Usha has presented a paper titled ”Design and implementation of a path guidance ballbot for the visually impaired” on June 2021.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS
The EEE department endeavor to streamline the career options and pave ways for recent graduates to explore new career opportunities. The department regularly organizes various placement activities with the help of industry experts and alumnus of the department who are working in reputed organizations.
View More

Electronics & Communication Engineering

Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Electronics & Communication Engineering
Admission Enquiry
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
Students will be able to:
PSO1:
Design, develop and integrate electronic circuits and systems using current practices and standards.
PSO2:
Apply knowledge of hardware and software in designing Embedded and Communication systems.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO1:
Successful in industry, academia, or entrepreneurship as a result of a strong teaching learning process, with keen interest in pursuing higher studies in various domains.
PEO2:
Capable of leading technological and managerial projects for serving industry and society with knowledge of Electronics and Communication Engineering.
PEO3:
Competent professional capable of adapting to changing technological scenarios and societal needs, with expertise in relevant domains.
PO
PO1. Engineering knowledge:
Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.
PO2. Problem analysis:
Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.
PO3. Design/development of solutions:
Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.
PO4. Conduct investigations of complex problems:
Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.
PO5. Modern tool usage:
Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modelling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.
PO6. The engineer and society:
Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.
PO7. Environment and sustainability:
Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
PO8. Ethics:
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
PO9. Individual and team work:
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.
PO10. Communication:
Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.
PO11. Project management and finance:
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
PO12. Life-long learning:
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
Vision
To achieve continuous improvement in quality technical education for global competence with focus on industry, societal needs, research and professional success.
Mission
Offering quality education in Electronics and Communication Engineering with effective teaching learning process in multidisciplinary environment.
Training the students to take-up projects in emerging technologies and work with team spirit.
To imbibe professional ethics, development of skills and research culture for better placement opportunities.
ECE Dept Video
From the HOD's Desk:
Greetings from the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE), Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering. The Department of ECE at DSCE provides high- quality, innovative technical education at the undergraduate, graduate, and research levels. The department faculty and support personnel are dedicated towards helping students achieve success in today's world by offering them the knowledge and skills required.
Dr. Shobha K R
Professor & HOD,
Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering.
View More
NEWS & EVENTS
Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos Theory in Engineering with Applications in Control Systems and Signal Analysis
Dr. C. Anil Kumar, Dr. C. K. Narayanappa, Prof. Rekha Krishna, Dr. K. R. Varalakshmi, and Dr. S. Ashwini, along with their co-authors, published a research paper titled “Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos Theory
in Engineering with Applications in Control Systems and Signal Analysis” in the Journal of Interdisciplinary Mathematics.
Tunnel Field Effect Transistors
In the area of intellectual property, Dr. Nithin Kumar N. R., Dr. Dinesha P., and Dr. Madhura R. were granted an Indian patent for their work on Tunnel Field Effect Transistors,
while Dr. Dinesha P. and team filed another patent on a Driver-Calibrated Brake Drag Detection and Alarm System.
Embedded Roots 2025
IEEE SPS DSCE Student Chapter, in association with the Department of ECE, organized the workshop “Embedded Roots 2025” on
8th December 2025. The beginner-friendly workshop focused on hands-on learning in IoT and Embedded Systems, providing students with practical exposure to microcontrollers, sensors, interfacing techniques, and debugging strategies.
Humanoid Robot Controlled by Real-Time Image Processing
Students of the 7th semester ECE department, Edwin C Daison (1DS22EC069), Eshwar L N (1DS22EC071), Sudharshan D Pai (1DS22EC223), and Sujith M S (1DS22EC227), secured First Prize in the Project Expo organized by HKBK College of Engineering for their project titled
“Humanoid Robot Controlled by Real-Time Image Processing,” developed under the guidance of Dr. Pavithra.
ICAISMART 2025
Gowtham O R (1DS23EC079), a 5th semester student, presented a research paper at the ICAISMART 2025 International
Conference held at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Bengaluru.
RISK RIDERS
Team “RISK RIDERS,” mentored by Dr. Jamuna S and Dr. Deepa N. P., comprising Vikith U S, Swasthik Kotian, Yashika C, Vishruth, Gowri Bandak, Aditya, Harshitha A,
and Ritika Shetty, was selected for the second round of the prestigious 1-TOPS program.
Smart India Hackathon 2025
Team Point Blank, including Shubhang Sinha (ECE) and interdisciplinary team members, won a prize money
of ₹1,50,000 at Smart India Hackathon 2025 – Software Edition.
Industrial Visit to ART-PARK
The Department of ECE organized a one-day industrial visit to ART-PARK (ART-Garage) on 16th December 2025. The visit was coordinated by Dr. Sreenath Settur, Dr. Jamuna S, Dr. Deepa N. P., Dr. Suma M. R., Dr. Manasa R., Dr. Madhura R., Prof. Navya Holla, Prof. Sowmya P., Prof. Chaitra S., Prof. Kavita Guddad, and Prof. Ravi Kumar S. Students attended technical talks on robotics,
autonomous systems, embedded systems, and startup ecosystems, followed by a guided tour of ART-PARK facilities
IConSCEPT 2025
Dr. Jamuna S and Hannan Ashrafi (JRF) received a Best Paper Award at IConSCEPT 2025
for their work in the VLSI Design and Embedded Systems track.
NPTEL
Dr. Deepa N. P. achieved multiple recognitions from NPTEL, including Discipline Star, Motivated Learner, and Believer awards.
Research Conclave 2025
Dr. P. Vimala received a Certificate of Research Recognition at Research Conclave 2025 organized by DSCE.
Embedded and IoT
A three-day Skill Development Program on Embedded and IoT was conducted from 4th to 6th December 2025 in association with TechnoVeda Solutions.
The program featured hands-on sessions led by Dr. Sandeep Chapalkar and Mr. Kotresh Mundrungi.
Architecture All Access: Modern CPU Architecture – Key Concepts
An Activity-Based Teaching session titled “Architecture All Access: Modern CPU Architecture – Key Concepts” was conducted for 3rd semester students,
coordinated by Prof. Aishwarya N under the guidance of Dr. Shobha K. R., Head of the Department.

ECE DEPARTMENT
Events Organised
The Department ECE regularly organizes Expert talks, SDP, Workshops, FDP, to provide students and faculty with insights into emerging technologies and industry trends. The sessions are always led by the distinguished expert in the field, offering valuable discussions on the advancements, limitations and future prospects.
Facilities
Department has class rooms, tutorial rooms with all equipped with projectors. It has well equipped laboratories with UPS Support. It has library of 20 sq feet containing around 800+ books with seating capacity of 20.
Research
The Department ECE is committed to advancing research in cutting-edge technologies, fostering innovation, and addressing real-world challenges. Our research spans diverse domains, including VLSI design, embedded systems, wireless communication, signal processing, AI, and the Internet of Things (IoT).
Department Newsletter
The Department ECE keeps students, faculty, and researchers informed about the latest developments through the Department News section. All significant events, including research breakthroughs, faculty and student achievements, expert talks, workshops, and industry collaborations, are captured in our monthly newsletter.
Department Highlights
The faculties have been grouped under 3 specialized areas of the field viz. Communication, VLSI and Embedded System, Image Processing and Signal Processing. Various Grants have been sanctioned from the organizations like ISRO, DST-IEDC and DRDO.
Department Publications
The Department ECE takes pride in its strong research output, with faculty and students actively contributing to high-impact journals, international conferences & technical symposiums. Through rigorous research and collaboration with academic institutions & industry leaders, we strive to advance knowledge and drive innovation.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS:
Dayananda Sagar Institutions has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students...
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

NEWS & EVENTS
Engineering Conclave 2025
Date: 28-06-2025
The Department of ISE is organizing a "Engineering Conclave 2025 " on 28-06-2025.
Cypherquest
Date: 25-04-2025 - 26-04-2025
CYPHERQUEST 2025 a 24-hour ACM Zonal Level HACKATHON will be conducted by the ISE department in collaboration with DSATAM on 25-04-2025 and 26-04-2025.
Catalysis V3.0
Date: 29-03-2025
Catalysis V3.0 the three day technical fest organized by Genesis student forum club of Department of ISE on 29-march- 2025.
Social Connect Event
Date: 14-09-2024
On September 14, 2024, the ISE department organized a social connect event at Government Higher Primary School , Karasavadi Village, Mandya to foster community engagement and support educational initiatives.
Research Avenues in Computer Networks, Communication and Security
Date: 19-08-2024 to 24-08-2024
The Department of ISE is organizing a Faculty Development Program on "Research Avenues in Computer Networks, Communication and Security " from 19-08-2024 to 24-08-2024.
Inauguration of IEEE Information Theory Society and Computer Society Student Chapter
Date: July 5th, 2024
The inauguration of the IEEE Information Theory Society and Computer Society Student Chapter at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering was a momentous occasion, uniting students, faculty members, and industry professionals in celebration of academic excellence and innovation in information theory and computer science.
Introduction to Game Theory and its Applications
Date: 5-06-2023
Technical talk on " Introduction to Game Theory and its Applications" on 5-06-2023 @ Department of ISE from 11:15am- 12-15pm.
VIEW MORE
Vision
To be recognized globally as a premier department in the field of Information Science and Engineering that provides transformative education with a focus on sustainable research and innovation to meet the ever-growing needs of the society.
Mission
The Department of Information Science and Engineering is committed to:
Quality Education:
Excellence in education, grounded in sustainable learning practices, critical thinking, and professional ethics.
Innovation:
Transform professionals into technically competent with lifelong learning skills through creativity & innovation ecosystem to solve critical problems, create leaders and entrepreneurs.
Impact on Society:
Preparing graduates of the future alongside the workforce to contribute to the society with a focus on sustainable and inclusive technology.
vISEsha
From the HOD's Desk:
Welcome to the new way of learning in the Department of Information Science and Engineering (ISE) at DSCE, Bengaluru!
The Department of ISE at DSCE is strongly committed to impart innovative and quality technical education with high standards at undergraduate, postgraduate, and research level. The faculty and supporting staff of the department is committed to prepare our students by providing the expertise and proficiency in Information Science and Engineering and its related fields needed to thrive in our modern society.
Dr. Annapurna P Patil
Dean Academics, Professor and HOD
Department of Information Science and Engineering.

View More
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
Engineering Graduates will be able to:
PSO1:
Apply mathematical and analytical knowledge to solve complex problems through computer programming skills.
PSO2:
Solve real-world engineering problems in information science engineering by applying the principles in Data Science, Network and Security, Gaming and Design, and Machine Intelligence.
PSO3:
Apply technical skills and research skills acquired through professional societies, certification programs, projects, internships and laboratory exercises to solve problems that provide sustainable solutions related to the society and the environment.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
Within a few years after graduation, the graduates of Information Science and Engineering will be able to:
PEO1:
Apply appropriate theory, practices, and tools to the specification, design, implementation, maintenance, and evaluation of information science & computing in the workplace or in the advanced studies.
PEO2:
Function effectively as competent professionals, leaders, entrepreneurs or researchers in the workplace, or maintain employment through lifelong learning including professional conferences, certificate programs or other professional activities and societal awareness.
PEO3:
Adapt, contribute and innovate new technologies in their computing profession to the society by working in teams to design, implement, and/or maintain in the key domains of Information Science Engineering.
PROGRAM OFFERED
UG Program
Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) in Information Science and Engineering (ISE)
PG Program
M. Tech in Computer Networks and Engineering (CNE)
Research Program
Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering

FACULTY INFO
ISE DEPARTMENT
Department Activities
The Department of ISE takes initiatives for overall development of students and give them practical orientation to inculcate employability skills which will help them to face this competitive world. The department activities conducted are focused on imparting technical knowledge along its application in the practical world.
Facilities
Department has class rooms, tutorial rooms with all equipped with projectors. The important laboratories include: Data Structures Laboratory , Database Applications Laboratory, System software Laboratory, Algorithms Laboratory etc
Research
Dr. Rajeshwari J & Mrs. Shalini K.B
successfully achieved research the grant from
Indian Council of Medical Research
for “Physiological changes and physical appearance of face in healthy newborn babies: a medico technical study” in 2021.
Department News
Congratulations to
Bhuvanesh P [1DS18IS023] of 7th sem
for winning
1st Place and grabbing “Gold Medal” with Cash Prize of 21,000 in
IndiaSkills Regional Competition – South,(Skill - Cloud Computing) at Visakhapatnam, A.P , held on
1st to 4th December 2021.
Department Highlights
Congratulations to
Mrs. Latha A.P
Asst. Professor, Dept of ISE, DSCE. on receiving grant of
Rs. 5,44,000/-
for the project entitled
“ Remote Basic Health Investigation (RBHI) by robotics limbs using Computer Vision Technology ”
from AI & Robotic Technology Park – IISC, Bangalore August 2021
DEPARTMENT PUBLICATIONS
The faculties and students of ISE Department actively pursue research along with the academics and publishes and presents papers in reputed National and International conferences. The results of the research are also published in peer reviewed journals. The details of the same can be viewed here.

Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
Admission Enquiry
PO
Program Outcomes
Engineering Graduates will be able to:
Engineering knowledge:
Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.
Problem analysis:
Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.
Design/development of solutions:
Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.
Conduct investigations of complex problems:
Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.
Modern tool usage:
Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.
The engineer and society:
Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.
Environment and sustainability:
Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
Ethics:
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
Individual and team work:
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.
Communication:
Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.
Project management and finance:
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
Life-long learning:
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
Graduates will be able to
PEO 1:
Have successful professional career in the core and allied domains
PEO 2:
Engage in continuous learning and adapt to modern technology
PEO 3:
Work in diverse environments exhibiting team work and leadership quality
PEO 4:
Analyze and provide the solutions to real-life engineering problems for the betterment of society
Vision
To meet the challenges of industry and research in the field of Electronics, Instrumentation and Control Engineering by providing quality technical education.
Mission
To impart quality education with an understanding of basic concepts.
To enhance knowledge in the core domains of Electronics and Instrumentation by providing a conducive learning environment.
To nurture the students with inter-disciplinary technology by contributing solutions for techno-social issues.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
Welcome to the Department of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering (EIE) at DSCE, established in 1992. We offer a robust undergraduate program in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, with an intake of 60. The department takes pride in providing a Ph.D. program, recognized as a research center by Visveswaraya Technological University, Belagavi. Our curriculum is thoughtfully crafted to address the ever-evolving challenges of global technology. Fostering a dynamic student culture, we provide cutting-edge infrastructure facilities, complemented by strong support from top management, ensuring our students excel in their professional journeys.
Dr. SATHEESH KUMAR J
Associate Professor & Head of the Department.
E-mail
:

NEWS & EVENTS
Industrial Visit
On February 13th, 2024, students from the V semester of the E&IE department had the opportunity to visit Continental Automotive Pvt. Ltd. India, in Bommasandra for an industrial visit. Continental AG is one of the world's largest automotive suppliers and manufacturers of various automotive components, systems, electronics, tires, and technical elastomers.
National Conference
The Department of Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering organized the 2nd National Conference on "Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Techniques for Electronics, Control & Automation" (NCAECA-2024) held from February 8th to 10th, 2024. The conference featured insightful keynote speeches from esteemed professionals representing various industries, who shared their invaluable experiences and expertise with the attendees.
HC-900 Honeywell’s Hybrid Controller
One day training program on HC-900 Honeywell’s Hybrid Controller was organized for faculty and students of Dept. of EIE on 11/12/2023. The training was given by Dr. Meenchatchi Sundaram.S, Additional Professor, Manipal Institute, Dept. of Instrumentation Control Engineering.
Industrial Visit To MTR
The purpose of the industrial visit was to provide real-world exposure to food processing automation and instrumentation systems. This visit enhanced the students' understanding of industrial automation, quality control, and the application of instrumentation in the food manufacturing industry.
Best Project of the Year 2022-23
Congratulations to the Project Team Mr. Prajwal Y S, Ms. Sneha M N, Ms. Aishwarya, Mr. Arunkumar guided by Dr. J S Rajasekar and Dr. S P Meharunnisa of Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering Department, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering for being awarded for the “BEST PROJECT OF THE YEAR 2022-23” in the 46th Series of Student Project Programme at STATE LEVEL SEMINAR AND PROJECT EXHIBITION held on 11th and 12th August 2023.
Week Long Expert Lecture Series
Department of Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering, HOD of the EI&E dept. Dr. J.S Rajashekar, professor, along with the session coordinator Dr. S.P Meharunnisa, assistant professor, Dept. of EI&E organized one-week long expert lecture sessions for students by experts from different platforms from February 6, 2023 to February 11, 2023
Artificial Intelligence for Embedded Systems
The Department of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering of Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bengaluru organised a 5 days' Students Development Training Program on "Artificial Intelligence for Embedded Systems", supported by AICTE MODROB Scheme, New Delhi, in association with STMicroelectronics, Bengaluru, DigiToad Technologies, Bengaluru and Advanced Electronics Systems Pvt Ltd, Bengaluru
Project Innovation Contest-2020
Mr.Balasubramani, Mr.Jnanesh, Mr.Akash of 6th semester have won 3rd prize in the 9th Project Innovation Contest-2020 organized by Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering Department
Invited Talk
A seminar on "Robotics Projects" was organized for III and V Semester students of EIE department on -5-09-2024. The session was conducted by Mr. Saurav Kumar, CEO of Robomanthan, Bengaluru, a leading expert in robotics and automation. The seminar aimed to provide students with an in-depth understanding of robotics projects, their real-world applications, and opportunities in the field.
Facilities
The department is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, including classrooms and tutorial rooms, all furnished with advanced projectors to enhance the learning experience. Furthermore, our laboratories feature cutting-edge research infrastructure, including interdisciplinary and industry-based labs.
Research
The Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering department holds recognition from VTU as a research centre, offering opportunities for PhD/M.Sc. (Engg) programs. Currently, the department is actively supporting the academic pursuits of 10 research scholars who are engaged in the pursuit of their doctoral degrees.
Department News
The Department of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, in collaboration with DigiToad Technologies, has organized a Skill Development Program focused on Sensing & Data Acquisition, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Industry 4.0, and the Internet of Things (IoT) for 5th semester students. The program commenced on 8th October 2024 and will continue throughout the semester, aiming to equip students with industry-relevant technical skills.
Department Highlights
The Department of Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering, in collaboration with Samprada Cancer Hospital, organized a Breast Cancer Awareness Program on October 30, 2024. The event aimed to educate participants on the importance of early detection and prevention of breast cancer while fostering a supportive community.
E-Learning
Department of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering has taken initiative in developing short online tutorials to help the students understand the fundamental concepts in various subjects.

The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

Mechanical Engineering
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Mechanical Engineering
Admission Enquiry
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
PSO 1
:Graduates will be able to apply basic science, mathematics and engineering knowledge to conceptualize, model, design and manufacture physical systems and processes.
PSO 2
: Graduates will be able to utilize the knowledge of advanced engineering tools in design & thermal engineering domain.
PSO 3
:Graduates will be able to lead professionally in an industrial environment by applying the management principles related to organizational planning, leadership, research, production and service activities.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO 1
: Graduates shall exhibit the Knowledge and Competency for successful career in Mechanical Engineering and pursue higher studies.
PEO 2
:Graduates shall exhibit the necessary skills and manage to interact in the field of profession with different Cross Functional Groups.
PEO 3
: Graduates shall demonstrate their Engineering Profession by adopting Ethical and Professional practices.
PEO 4
: Graduates shall engage in Professional society interaction, training and research to enable Life Long Learning.
Vision
To Prepare Mechanical Engineers having technical competency and managerial skills driven by human values and ignite the young minds capable of addressing ever-changing global issues by research and innovation.
Mission
To Provide a platform that imparts Scientific Knowledge and Technical skills.
To Train students to demonstrate their Communication and Managerial skills with Ethical practices.
To Engage students in professional activities through Research, Higher Education and Life Long Learning.
From the HOD's Desk:
The Department of Mechanical Engineering, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, was started in the year 1979. Our department offers undergraduate courses in Mechanical Engineering with the present intake of 120 students. Department has the excellent Placement record with the students getting placed in reputed core industries as well as IT sectors. Our students have won awards at various technical events, conferences and symposiums held at prestigious institutions. The Department has dedicated and experienced faculty team with more than Nineteen PhDs, driving the department towards excellence in academics as well as R & D activities.
Dr. Srinath M S
Professor & HOD,
Mechanical Department.

MECHANICAL DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
The Department of Mechanical Engineering organizes technical talks each semester through various events, including: Guest Lecture, Student Development Program, Seminars and Symposiums, Technical Fest
Facilities
The Mechanical Engineering Department boasts modern labs with research infrastructure, fostering interdisciplinary and industry-oriented learning. Classrooms are equipped with projectors, and labs house high-quality machinery and software. A dedicated library supports students with 1200+ wide range of books.
Research
The department boasts 26 doctorates and 14 faculty members nearing completion of their PhDs. Emphasis is placed on interdisciplinary research, with project grants exceeding ₹1 crore (₹129.055 lakhs). Faculty and students actively publish in peer-reviewed journals and conferences.
Department News
The Department of Mechanical Engineering in collaboration with WINSUN GLOBAL TECH PVT. LTD., is hosted a one-week program on AI & ML Applications in Mechanical Engineering fourth-semester & Sixth Semester students
Department Highlights
Department of mechanical Organising a International Conference on “Sustainable Design for Manufacturing, Mobility & Energy Systems” (SDMME-2K25) on 18th and 19th September 2025
Department Publications
Our faculty actively pursue work in professional practice, research and service projects, and participation in publications, and presentations of papers at professional meetings.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS:

The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

Medical Electronics Engineering
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Medical Electronics Engineering
Admission Enquiry
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
Graduates will be able to
PSO 1
: Apply the knowledge of electronics for solving diverse problems of Medical Instrumentation
PSO 2
: Analyse and implement different techniques in Medical Image and Signal Processing domains catering to Design, Research and Development
PSO 3
: Provide sustainable solutions in health care and its allied fields by imbibing managerial and techno-social values.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
Graduates will be able to
PEO 1
: Apply knowledge of Medical Electronics to excel in their profession
PEO 2
: Practice engineering to analyse problems and find solutions in allied domains using multidisciplinary approach
PEO 3
: Disseminate professional skills for ethical and societal responsibilities
PEO 4
: Engage in lifelong learning and contribute in the field of engineering research
PROCESS
Process
Process of program curriculum
Process of Teaching-Learning Process
Process of Designing the Program Curriculum
Process of Preparation of Curriculum Structure
Vision
To develop an excellent centre of progressive quality learning, applied & translational research through inventive collaborations and sustainable solutions to address healthcare related societal challenges
Mission
By creating a conducive atmosphere for continuous learning through increased participation of students and faculty in various academic activities
By achieving needful and relevant healthcare solutions through quality education and research
By imparting education in the path of ethical and social responsibilities, to work effectively with diverse groups for the benefit of the society
From the HOD's Desk:
Department of Medical Electronics has been playing a vital role in producing technologists of leading talents ever since it was established in the year 1996. The Department has applied engineering principles to address medical and biological problems. Over the years the Department has become one of the best Departments in the university.
Dr. Sriraam N
Dean R&D
Professor and HOD
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering

NEWS & EVENTS
“INNOVATIVE AND FRUGAL ENGINEERING SOLUTIONS TO HEALTH CARE”
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized "INNOVATIVE AND FRUGAL ENGINEERING SOLUTIONS TO HEALTH CARE" on 20TH TO 25TH March 2023.
“Crystalizing Problem Statements for Seeking Digital Healthcare Solutions”
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized "Crystalizing Problem Statements for Seeking Digital Healthcare Solutions" on 6th to 10th March 2023.
Workshop on Embedded Systems and IOT in Healthcare
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized Workshop on Embedded Systems and IOT in Healthcare on 14th to 18th Dec 2022.
Technical Symposium on Current Trends in HealthCare
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized Technical Symposium on Current Trends in HealthCare on Dec 1st 2022.
Invited Talk on Embedded Systems on IOT Application
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized Invited Talk on Embedded Systems on IOT Application on 14th Oct 2022.
Invited Talk on Awareness on Higher Studies
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering organized Invited Talk on Awareness on Higher Studies on 11th Oct 2022
Project Open Day 2022
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering presents Project Open Day 2022 on JUNE 24TH 2022.
TECHNICAL TALK ON COMPUTER AIDED DIAGNOSIS SYSTEMS FOR CT IMAGES
TECHNICAL TALK ON COMPUTER AIDED DIAGNOSIS SYSTEMS FOR CT IMAGES by MR. RAHUL RAMESH
EXPERT LECTURE ON “MEDICAL DEVICES AND REGULATIONS”
EXPERT LECTURE ON “MEDICAL DEVICES AND REGULATIONS” by Mr. BHASKAR CHIKKANNA
TECHNICAL TALK ON SOFTWARE AS MEDICAL DEVICES
TECHNICAL TALK ON SOFTWARE AS MEDICAL DEVICES by Mr. Arun Kohli
Online Expert Lecture on MICROFLUIDICS - FREE HEALTHCARE DIAGNOSTICS
Online Expert Lecture on MICROFLUIDICS - FREE HEALTHCARE DIAGNOSTICS by Dr. V V. RAGHA VENDRA SAI
Three Day Online Workshop On PROTEUS SIMULATiON TOOL
Three Day Online Workshop On PROTEUS SIMULATiON TOOL by Prof Bharadwaj M. & Prot S. Hema Priyadarshini Department of Medical Electronics Engineering, DSCE
National Level Technical Project presentation
Student projects have been selected for paper and poster presentation at National Level Technical Project presentation at Techfinix ’19 at Paavai Engineering College, Namakal, Tamil Nadu on 20th and 21st September 2019.
Arduino workshop
A two-day workshop on 'Hardware Interfacing with Arduino' was conducted at the Department of Medical Electronics, DSCE in association with the student chapter of Instrument Society of India on 24.9.2019 and 25.9.2019 for the students of 3rd semester.
Sagar Hospital Visit
The students of V Sem visited Sagar Hospital as part of the hospital visit program on 5th, 12th & 26th of September 2019 between 2 to 5 pm. They visited radiology department and were exposed to machines & got the practical knowledge of the working of these machines.
Teachers’ day celebration
Teachers’ day celebration was celebrated in the Medical Electronics Department on 5th September 2019, by the student club “AIKYA”. The students shared their opinion on the role of Teachers contribution in shaping their lives.
Workshop on Chatbot Design
Workshop was organized on Chatbot Design on 12-10-2019 in association with ISOI student chapter, Medical Electronics Department, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering.

MEDICAL ELECTRONICS ENGINEERING
Invited Talk
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering regularly conducts Expert-Talks.
Facilities
The Department of Medical Electronics Engineering is well equipped with modern facilities in class rooms and laboratories. An exclusive department library facility is available equipped with latest text books, reference books, e-journals etc.
Research
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering various grants from esteemed research organizations of India like: Visual Group of Science and Technology (VGST), Department of Science and Technology (DST), VGST – TRIP (Technology Related Innovation Project), Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Center (IEDC)/DST, Bangalore.
Department News
Basic Healthcare Training to Siemens employees was jointly organized by Department of Medical Electronics Engineering and Centre for Advanced Healthcare, Dayananda Sagar University from 3rd September to 7th September 2018.
Department Highlights
Department of Medical Electronics Engineering has bagged 2 UG University ranks for the academic year 2016 – 17and a total of 40 UG University ranks till date.
Publications
Journal of Physics: Conference Series, “Early Detection of Diabetic Foot Ulcer”
PLACEMENT STATISTICS:
Dayananda Sagar Institutions has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students...
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
Admission Enquiry
POs
Program Outcomes
Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering Graduates will be able to:
PO1: Engineering Knowledge:
Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, computing, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialization as specified in WK1 to WK4 respectively to develop to the solution of complex engineering problems.
PO2: Problem Analysis:
Identify, formulate, review research literature and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions with consideration for sustainable development. (WK1 to WK4)
PO3: Design/Development of Solutions:
Design creative solutions for complex engineering problems and design/develop systems/components/processes to meet identified needs with consideration for the public health and safety, whole-life cost, net zero carbon, culture, society and environment as required. (WK5)
PO4: Conduct Investigations of Complex Problems:
Conduct investigations of complex engineering problems using research-based knowledge including design of experiments, modelling, analysis & interpretation of data to provide valid conclusions. (WK8).
PO5: Engineering Tool Usage:
Create, select and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern engineering & IT tools, including prediction and modelling recognizing their limitations to solve complex engineering problems. (WK2 and WK6)
PO6: The Engineer and The World:
Analyze and evaluate societal and environmental aspects while solving complex engineering problems for its impact on sustainability with reference to economy, health, safety, legal framework, culture and environment. (WK1, WK5, and WK7).
PO7: Ethics:
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics, human values, diversity and inclusion; adhere to national & international laws. (WK9)
PO8: Individual and Collaborative Team work:
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse/multi-disciplinary teams.
PO9: Communication:
Communicate effectively and inclusively within the engineering community and society at large, such as being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations considering cultural, language, and learning differences
PO10: Project Management and Finance:
Apply knowledge and understanding of engineering management principles and economic decision-making and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, and to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
PO11: Life-Long Learning:
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability for
PEOs
Program Educational Objectve
PEO-1:
The graduate envisages the vision of the department, on engineering needs of the country at large and industry in specific and thereby contribute services with perspective of self-sustenance through higher studies, and research in the program domain.
PEO-2:
The graduate enduring the optimally designed curriculum, demonstrates ability to analyze Scientific, Mathematical perspectives of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering and apply its knowledge with multidisciplinary approach for solving real life problems for a successful career.
PEO-3:
The graduate possesses professional attitude for career building in the society, ability to work and lead a team with highest integrity and ethical values for managing large corporate projects through suitable research and development.
PEO-4:
The graduate demonstrates lifelong learning to upgrade knowledge of emerging technologies through training, interaction with professional bodies for finding sustainable solution to changing scenarios of the technology frontiers, emphasizing on security and safety concern of individual and global environment.
PSOs
Programme Specfic Outcome
PSO1:
To apply fundamental concepts of electrical, electronic devices and circuits to communication theory and systems on par with the electronics and telecommunication industry domain.
PSO2:
To apply the core merits of embedded systems, signal processing and network protocols for electronics and telecommunication standards.
PSO3:
To design secured cognitive collaborative solutions related to electronics and telecommunication systems.
Vision
To disseminate quality technical education for achieving Academic Excellence through focused research and innovation encompassing contemporary technologies trends in electronic devices, Telecommunication systems and standards for societal needful applications, of country in specific and global at broader perspective.
Mission
By adopting quality curriculum design, associated with standard teaching learning process and assessment techniques; on par with standards for portability of graduates globally.
By educating students towards contemporary technologies through consistent perseverance with the leading industries based on the current socio-economic conditions of the society.
By inculcating research attitude among graduates through lifelong learning in pursuit of academic excellence and career enrichment.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
Greetings from the Department of Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering!
Our department strives to nurture technically competent, research-oriented, and socially responsible engineers who can contribute meaningfully to the rapidly evolving domains of communication systems, embedded design, digital electronics, and intelligent networks.
Dr. Jugul Kishor Gupta
Professor and HOD

Open Day Project Exhibition 2023
Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering ,Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering organized Open Day Project Exhibition 2023 on June 10th to display and showcase their research work for the society.

ELECTRONICS AND TELECOMMUNICATION DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
Invited talk on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning by Mr. Poorna Pragna the Alumni and Entrepreneur of Telecommunication Engineering Department for 6th semester students.
Facilities
TCE Department has class rooms, tutorial rooms with all equipped with projectors.Department has well equipped laboratories with UPS Support.IEEE access for both students and faculties.
Research
Faculty Members of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering Registered for Doctorate Program.and TEC Department has successfully completed 1 projects on Investigation of speed and power in sub 100nm memory circuits.
Department News
Five days Faculty Development Programme on Embedded Systems & IoT Applications was held in the department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering during 26th – 30th July 2019 in association with Texas Instruments University Program.
Department Highlights
Department ETE, had the inauguration Ceremony for the “Industry on Campus” with “Zesty Beanz Technology” a global company for IoT solutions on 20th February 2025. The inauguration was at the hands of Dr. B. G. Prasad, Principal, DSCE and Mr. Leepesh, MD, Zesty Beanz Technologies, Thiruvananthapuram
Department Publications
The faculty of TEC Department have published various papers in various occasions they have published so many journals.they have attended international conferences.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS:
Dayananda Sagar Institutions has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students...
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
Home
>
Academics
>
UG Programs
>
Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
Admission Enquiry
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO 1
: Graduates will excel in designing, developing, and deploying innovative solutions in robotics and artificial intelligence, leveraging interdisciplinary knowledge in engineering, computer science, and mathematics.
PEO 2
: Graduates will engage in cutting-edge research and tackle complex engineering challenges in robotics and AI through critical thinking, advanced analytical techniques, and creative problem-solving approaches.
PEO 3
: Graduates will be prepared for successful careers in industries related to robotics, automation, AI, and related domains or as entrepreneurs capable of developing novel technologies and startups.
PEO 4
: Graduates will apply their knowledge of robotics and AI responsibly, considering ethical implications, sustainability, and the societal impact of their work on global challenges.
From the HOD's Desk:
Welcome to the Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, where interdisciplinary innovation drives the future of intelligent systems. Our engineering program is designed to provide a strong foundation across key domains such as Mechatronics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Robot Operating System (ROS), and Robotic Design, while also integrating advanced technologies like Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computer Vision. These areas empower robots to interact intelligently with both humans and their environments, enabling applications from autonomous navigation to smart manufacturing and assistive technologies. The curriculum blends theoretical learning with hands-on experience, encouraging students to design, build, and program autonomous systems capable of sensing, understanding, and adapting to real-world challenges. Through cutting-edge labs, research- driven instruction, and industry partnerships, we aim to develop innovative engineers ready to lead in the fast-evolving fields of robotics, automation, and AI-powered solutions.
Dr. Nagendra J
Associate Professor & HOD
E-mail:
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Phone:
08042161741
Vision
To provide students with a comprehensive and cutting-edge education in Robotics and Artificial Intelligence to the highest quality who are professionally competent and highly qualified to tackle real-world problems and innovations by promoting excellence in teaching, learning and research.
Mission
Provide high quality education that imparts Scientific Knowledge and Technical skills to fulfil the requirements of a ‘Global Engineer’.
Training their Communication and Managerial skills for promoting technology transfer, supporting start-up and collaborating with industry partners to translate research into real-world solution.
Inculcate students in professional activities with ethics, integrity, honesty and credibility, social and environmental consciousness.
Share:

Telecom Alumni side
Home
>
Civil Engineering
>
Courses offered
>
Telecom Alumni side
Admission Enquiry
PG course
Courses Type                         :
Post Graduate
Duration                                  :
Two Years (4 Semesters)
Department                             :
Department of Civil Engineering
Specialization                   :
Structural Engineering (CSE)
Highway Technology (CHT)
Eligibility:
Candidates who got their BE/ B.Tech /AMIE or equivalent degree securing not less than 50% marks in aggregate in Computer Science / Information Science / Electronics & Communication Engineering / Telecommunication Engineering / Electrical & Electronics Engineering.
UG course
Courses Type                         :
Under Graduate
Duration                                  :
Four Years
Department                             :
Department of Civil Engineering
Eligibility:
Candidates who have completed their PUC / (10+2) with minimum of 45% aggregate in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry and should have appeared for at least one of the entrance exams (CET, COMED-K, JEE).

Electronics & Communication  Engineering

Courses offered
Admission Enquiry
UG course
UG Course
:
Bachelor of Engineering (BE)
Type
:
Regular - Autonomous
Degree
:
Bachelor Degree
Course Type
:
Undergraduate (UG)
Course Duration
:
4 Years (for Regular Students) for 10 + 2 students … 8 Semesters 3 years (for Diploma / Lateral Entry Students) …. 6 Semesters
Department
:
Electronics & Communication Engineering (ECE)
Norms for admission
or
Eligibility to UG
Programme
:
Candidates who have completed or passed their PUC / (10+2) / CBSE / ICSE / State Board or Central Board or equivalent examination with a minimum of 50 % aggregate in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry (PCM) and should have appeared for at least one of the entrance exams (CET, COMED-K, JEE), with any one of the following subjects : Chemistry / Computer Science / Electronics and English as a compulsory subject.
PG course
PG Course
:
Master of Technology (M.Tech.)
Type
:
Regular - Autonomous
Degree
:
Post-Graduation Degree
Course Type
:
Post-graduate (PG)
Total Credits
:
88
Course Duration
:
2 Years (Regular) for BE/B.Tech. students … 4 Semesters
Department
:
Electronics & Communication Engg. (ECE)
Specialization – 1
:
VLSI Design & Embedded Systems (VLSIDES)
click here for course full details
Norms for admission
or
Eligibility to PG
Programme
:
Candidates who have completed or passed their B.E. / B.Tech. Engineering Examination (ECE, EEE, EIE, TCE, ETCE, Medical Electronics) or equivalent examination with a minimum of 50 % aggregate in the relevant field of Engg. Course in VTU or any other university / institution or any other examination recognized as equivalent degree in any state of the country, PGCET is compulsory / eligible GATE score required.
PhD course
PhD Course
:
Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Engineering
Degree
:
Ph.D. Degree
Research Centre
:
VTU Research Centre, ECE Dept., DSCE, Bangalore
Course Type
:
Research
Course Duration
:
Full Time (3 to 6 years) / Part Time (4 to 7 years) including the coursework from the date of provisional registration
Department
:
Electronics & Communication Engineering
Norms for admission
or
Eligibility to
PhD Programme
:
The Candidates shall possess a Master’s Degree in Engineering / Technology or Equivalent Degree or M.S. (Research) Degree from the University or any other University recognized by VTU in the appropriate branch / subject / discipline, with a minimum CGPA of 6.75 out of 10 or 60% aggregate marks at the Bachelor’s & Master’s Degree Levels in Engineering Course. The research scholar can be a faculty of any engineering college either from the host institution or any other engineering college in the country or can be from any industry, but the research guide has to be from DSCE only.
https://vtu.ac.in/en/ph-d/

UG Program
Courses Type                         :
Under Graduate
Duration                                    :
Four Years
Department                            :
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Eligibility:
Candidates who have completed their PUC / (10+2) with minimum of 45% aggregate in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry and should have appeared for at least one of the entrance exams (CET, COMED-K, JEE).
View More
Doctoral Program
Candidates enrolling for PhD at VTU Research Centre of the Department will be receiving a Doctoral degree in Computer Science & Engineering from VTU.
PG Program
Courses Type                         :
Post Graduate
Duration                                    :
Two Years (4 Semesters)
Department                            :
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Eligibility:
As per AICTE New Delhi and Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) Karnataka. For details please
click here.

The Department of Management Studies, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering is a globalized center of learning business with an excellent industry interface to leverage the present-day business and academic scenario and to enable the students to face challenges in a competitive manner. Established in 2006, the department's flagship program is a two year MBAaffiliated to VTU (AICTE approved)

Master of Computer Applications
Home
>
Academics
>
PG Programs
>
Master of Computer Applications
Admission Enquiry
"First Semester MCA classes will commence on 13th February 2023, Building no13 opposite to Football ground in OFFLINE mode. "
Click here for the Tentative Time Table
PSO
Program Specific Outcomes
PSO1: Software Engineering and Emerging Technologies Proficiency:
Graduates will be able to design, develop, and maintain software systems by applying core computing principles and leveraging emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, and Cloud Computing.
PSO2: Professional Ethics and Societal Impact:
Graduates will demonstrate professional, ethical, and leadership qualities with a strong sense of societal responsibility, delivering innovative solutions through effective communication and teamwork.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
PEO 1
: Graduates will demonstrate the ability to apply theoretical foundations and practical approaches in the design, development, maintenance and evaluation of sustainable and efficient computing systems.
PEO 2
: Graduates will grow into diverse roles such as innovators, entrepreneurs and researchers, showcasing professional distinction in the field of computing.
PEO 3
: Graduates will possess a clear understanding of their professional and ethical responsibilities and implement the same in their workplace/career.
PO
Program Outcomes:
PO1: Foundation Knowledge:
:  Apply knowledge of mathematics, programming, logic, and coding fundamentals for solution architecture and problem solving.
PO2: Problem Analysis:
:  Identify, review, formulate, and analyse problems for primarily focusing on customer requirements using critical thinking frameworks.
PO3: Development of Solutions:
:  Design, develop, and investigate problems with an innovative approach for solutions incorporating ESG/SDG goals.
PO4: Modern Tool Usage:
:  Select, adapt, and apply modern computational tools, such as the development of algorithms with an understanding of the limitations, including human biases.
PO5: Individual and Teamwork:
:  Function and communicate effectively as an individual or a team leader in diverse and multidisciplinary groups. Use methodologies such as agile.
PO6: Project Management and Finance:
:  Use the principles of project management, such as scheduling, and work breakdown structure, and be conversant with the principles of Finance for profitable project management.
PO7: Ethics:
:  Commit to professional ethics in managing software projects with financial aspects. Learn to use new technologies for cyber security and insulate customers from malware.
PO8: Life-long learning:
:  Change management skills and the ability to learn, and keep up with contemporary technologies and ways of working
Vision
To foster progressive learning in Computer Science and Applications through quality education, research and innovation, aiming to develop industry-ready professionals committed to sustainable, inclusive technology for societal and global impact.
Mission
To foster an academic culture that encourages students to develop strong analytical, problem-solving and technical skills.
To provide dynamic and experiential learning through collaborative research projects, industry internships and entrepreneurial initiatives focused on sustainable development.
To empower students with ethical values & leadership skills, ensuing in creating a positive impact on society.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
Achievers of the Department
From the HOD's Desk:
The Department of MCA believes in creating a
“want to learn”
culture through state of the art infrastructure. We offer the most effective teaching learning methodologies through class room and practical exercises to cultivate an inquisitive mind-set among students. We aim to be the first choice in the state/country among aspiring computer science graduates. The skills and education imparted enables students to utilize new technologies and prepare them for key technology application and decision-making. The learning experience is wholesome, tailored to suit the needs of the industry and individual career development.
Dr. Samitha Khaiyum
Professor & Head of the Department.
View More
Department Activities
"Mobile Gaming "
ADVAYA – An inter college event organized by Dept. of MCA, RVITM , Bangalore on 11-03-2025 to 12-03-2025
"Machine Learning Techniques with a Demonstration on Azure Services"
The Department of MCA, in collaboration with Institute’s Innovation Council organized an enlightening Guest Lecture on "Machine Learning Techniques with a Demonstration on Azure Services "
"IBM Magic Bus DSCE MCA Skill Development"
The Department of Master of Computer Applications organized IBM Magic Bus DSCE MCA Skill Development on 18th Dec 2024 to 20th Dec 2024.
