MCA DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
The department of MCA is more focused on bridging the gap between industry and academia. In views of this, the department invites eminent resource persons from industry to apprise students and faculty members.
Facilities
At the Department of MCA, the emphasis is on a robust teaching learning process through the utilization of state of the art facilities such as well-equipped laboratories, departmental library and central library with journals and e-books. Students are encouraged to make full utilization of sports facilities, gym, dance studio and meditation room available in the campus
Research
The faculty in the department are involved in research activity such as HCI, Software engineering, HPC, Cloud computing, Computer Networks, Artificial Intelligence and Data Mining. Interested students are encouraged to work with the faculty on various problems. Faculty research papers are published frequently in journals with high impact factor.
Department Activities
The department of MCA encourages the conduction of Webinars, Workshops, Technical talks on Latest trends and technologies. It is a common practice followed in the department to enlighten both students and faculty members on cutting edge technologies.
Department Highlights
Our students have exhibited their proficiency by securing ranks every year. A Techno-Cultural fest “Algorythm” is organized annually and to hone the skills of the students.
Department Publications
Students and Faculty members of the department have made significant contributions to research through books, research publications and patents.
PLACEMENT STATISTICS
Dayananda Sagar Institutions has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students...
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements...

physics
Home
>
Academics
>
Basic science and humanities
>
Physics
>
physics
Admission Enquiry
PSO
Program Outcomes
PO 1
: Students can understand the importance of Physics in the practical applications.
PO 2
: Students gain knowledge in various techniques and working principles related to devices or components.
PO 3
:Students get an understanding of the characteristics of various types of materials.
PO 4
:Students will be able to demonstrate an ability to visualize and work in the Physics laboratory and multidisciplinary tasks.
PEO
Program Education Objectives
Preparation
: To support the engineering students to develop a scientific attitude in their professional advancement with a basic knowledge in the developments in Science and Technology.
Core Competence
:To impart basic knowledge in Science and Technology and to create a scientific temper in approaching a problem.
Breadth
: To support the students in gaining knowledge in various principles of Science and Engineering and to train the students in using various scientific measuring equipments.
Professionalism
: To train the students to acquire skills in various principles and equipments in the field of Science and technology.
Learning Environment:
: To provide the students for a professional learning environment to progress themselves to serve the society with a professional manner following the ethics.
Vision
To be a competent Physics department which addresses Global challenges emphasizing on development of a sustainable and inclusive technology.
Mission
To train students on principles and techniques in Physics.
To give hands on experience on various experiments and measuring instruments.
To collaborate with industry partners and professional societies and make the students industry ready.
To support students in uderstanding the importance of sustainable and inclusive technology and to gain knowledge in interdisciplinary areas of Science and Technology.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
Engineering Physics department is one of the oldest departments at DSI and the faculties are experts in the fields of physics and nanotechnology and are leaders in a broad range of physics research, utilizing facilities and technologies that are continually being modified and improved.
Our department was established in 1979, and since then, we have grown into a strong and vibrant department with eminent faculty vigorously pursuing world-class research. Our students have access to state-of-the-art teaching laboratories and are involved in innovative research projects in our research labs.
Dr. C. M. Joseph
Professor & Head of the Department.

:

PHYSICS DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
The Department of Physics, DSCE in association with the circuit branches jointly organized a talk by Dr. Phaneendra K Yalavarthy, Professor in the Department of Computational and Data Sciences, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India. on Computational methods in medical imaging and deep learning in medical imaging.
Facilities
Department of Physics has well equipped smart class rooms. All the UG laboratories in the department are equipped with UPS support. A specialized thin film and nanotechnology lab is available in the department to support the research students.
Research
All the doctorates in the department are registered guides for the VTU recognized research centre and the areas of research includes studies on organic and inorganic sensors and devices.
Department News
The Department of Engineering Physics conducts several activities for the first year students apart from their regular academics.
Department Highlights
Department of Physics in DSCE focuses on many student centric and faculty centric activities and projects. Department of Physics has sanctioned projects worth Rs 45 Lakhs from various scientific agencies.
Department Publications
All the faculties of Physics department publish their research results in reputed conferences and international journals. Areas of research publications include Materials science, Thin film devices and Sensors.

Chemistry
Home
>
Academics
>
Basic science and humanities
>
Chemistry
Admission Enquiry
FACULTY
Dr. K S Anantha Raju
Dr. M Dinamani
Dr. M Sennappan
Dr. B Uma
Dr. S Meena
Dr. B Hemavathi
Dr. P Karuppasamy
Dr. B S Surendra
Dr. Arpita Paul Chowdhury
Dr. G Vidya
Dr. I Pradeep
Dr. Jyoti Krishna Dutta
Dr. Aravind Raviraj Nesaragi
Dr. Swarnalata Swain
Dr. Vinuta Vishnu Kamat
Vision
To be a role model to serve the Nation’s needs by encouraging the study of Chemistry as a means for improving the condition of mankind by ameliorating his environment.
Mission
To adopt the best pedagogical methods in order to maximize knowledge transfer.
To have adequate mechanisms to enhance understanding of Implementation of theoretical concepts in practical scenarios
To carry out high quality research leading to the creation of knowledge and of intellectual property.
To provide the best facility, infrastructure, and environment to its students, researchers and faculty members.
To impart professional ethics and an approach towards inter- disciplinary thinking by providing them with educational and research opportunities between Chemistry and other fields of study.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
Department of Engineering Chemistry was established in the year 1979 and is one of the oldest departments of DSCE. The department offers courses for first year BE and second year Chemical Engineering. Department also offers Ph.D. degree in various specializations of Chemistry.
The Department is equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure which includes a VTU research center, affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi. The department is currently executing a research project from VGST under the scheme CESEM. The department holds many publications in peer-reviewed international journals with high impact factor. Department of Chemistry has MOU for Research and holds an institutional membership with Electrochemical Society of India, IISc campus. The faculty is experienced, committed, highly qualified with Doctorates in various specializations. Students are encouraged to participate in extra-curricular and co-curricular activities. Industry Institute interaction is nurtured by organizing and coordinating frequent industrial visits, Expert Lectures and Seminars.
Dr. K. S. Anantha Raju
Professor & HOD
E-mail
:
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Phone
: +91-80-42161700

COURSES OFFERED
UG Program
Supporting Department for all the branches of Engineering
Doctoral Program
Ph.D in Chemistry
News & Events
The Department of Chemistry is active in curricular, co-curricular and research programmes. The latest news and events listings can be found here.
CHEMISTRY DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
As a part of application based learning, Department of Chemistry regularly organizes invited talks for the students and faculty to update themselves with latest and interdisciplinary emerging technologies that impacts our life
Facilities
Well-equipped laboratories are available for conducting physical and chemical experiments to estimate the substances in qualitatively and quantitatively. There is also a separate research laboratory approved by VTU and Mangalore University.
Research
Department of Chemistry focuses its research collaborations and activities havingpractical implications in developing alternative solutions towards environmental problems and development of society.
Department News
The Department of Chemistry is active in curricular, co-curricular and research programmes. The latest news and events listings can be found here.
Department Highlights
The Department offers courses for first year BE and various branches of Engineering. Department also offers Ph.D. degree in various specializations of Chemistry. The Department is equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure which includes a VTU research centre, affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi.
Department Publications
Our faculty actively pursue work in professional practice, research and service projects, and participation in publications, and presentations of papers at professional meetings.

Mathematics

FDP on Computational Mathematics for Engineers, Industry and Beyond

"Conference Brochure: Computational Methods in Applied Science and Engineering

Department of Mathematics has signed MOU with Karnataka Science and Technology Academy(KSTA), Govt of Karnataka.
Department patent list

Vision
To create lifelong competent and socially innovative Engineers capable of working in multicultural environment in the world.
Mission
To Enhance Mathematical knowledge which will enable them to analyze, interpret and optimize any engineering related problem.
To imbibe interest in the convergence of Science and Technology through continuous Research activities.
To provide a platform to develop extraordinary professionals with high ethical values to meet the future age world.
The department Vision - Mission statements are formulated in accordance with the goals and objectives of the department keeping Institutional goals and objectives under consideration.
From the HOD's Desk:
The department of Mathematics at DSCE was established in the year 1979 with a vision of “creating lifelong competent and socially innovative Engineers, capable of working in multi-cultural environment in the world”.
Mathematics, the study of quantity, structure, space, and change, is used as an essential tool in natural sciences, engineering, medicine, and the social sciences. The subject, that seeks to establish the truth by arduous deduction, being the core foundation of the Field of Engineering, aids to build Analytical, Reasoning & Logical skills of the future Engineers and Researchers. Continuous Learning and Research activities satisfy the curiosity of students & it fulfils the objective of our department.
The Department has an excellent research reputation, a strong demanding program, and a full range of excellent course offerings. The department offers courses for first & second year BE that also includes Labs, Institutional electives during higher semesters, and courses for first-year M. Tech in various branches of Engineering. The Department has R&D centre, established in 2013, affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi, through which it offers Ph.D. programs in various specializations of Mathematics. The department has faculty with research interests in virtually every area of mathematics and they regularly publish quality research papers in peer-reviewed National and International Journals. The department has a strong Industry connection through which the curriculum is designed and implemented. It recently completed a research project from ISRO and few DST projects are under review process. The department has been sanctioned with two ATAL-FDP’s. To protect the research ideas, department has filed national and international patents of which five are published and granted.
The department has a Student & Faculty club in Mathematics which provides a unique platform for various disciplines. One of the best practices of the department is to release a newsletter bi-yearly to showcase the activities and growth of the department.
Dr. Geetha N K
Professor & HOD, Department of Mathematics
E-mail
:
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

: +91-80-42161730
NEWS & EVENTS
FDP on Computational Mathematics for Engineers, Industry and Beyond
The AICTE Training and Learning (ATAL) Academy sponsored One week Faculty Development Program on “COMPUTATIONAL MATHEMATICS FOR ENGINEERS, INDUSTRY AND BEYOND” which is being held from 5 th to 10 th Feb 2024 in which around 42 participants from different parts of India participated.
Workshop on Applications of Biostatistics
Department of Mathematics conducted One Day Workshop entitled “Applications of Biostatistics” on 26 th February, 2020. Speaker provided hands-on training on the various tests to be adopted for qualitative and quantitative biological data and explained when and where to apply the exact statistical techniques namely correlation, regression, chi square, t- test and ANOVA.
Workshop on Quality Research Publications and Patenting
Department of Mathematics, DSCE conducted One day workshop on Quality Research Publications and Patenting on 24th January 2020. This workshop mainly focused on how to bring the quality publications.
Workshop on “Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics: The Future
Two-day workshop on “Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics: the future” was conducted on 25th & 26th November 2019. The workshop focused on how the data analytics and artificial intelligence technologies are transforming the organizations, industries and society in general & it’s impact in future.
NUMBER NINJA COMPETITION 2019
Department of Mathematics conducted “NUMBER NINJA COMPETITION 2019” on 4th November 2019. Under this competition, an event was conducted called Number Game which was a team event. In ‘Number Ninja’, ‘Number’ means mathematical puzzles and ‘Ninja’ means who could solve problems quickly.
VIEW MORE
wxMaxima for Second semester
wxMaxima for Second semester
Emerging trends in Application of Mathematics
The Department of Mathematics has organised FDP sponsored by AICTE-ATAL titled “Emerging trends in Application of Mathematics” from 6 th to 10 th December 2021.
Computational Mathematics and AI for Engineers
The Department of Mathematics has organised FDP sponsored by AICTE-ATAL titled “Computational Mathematics and AI for Engineers” from 13 th to 17 th December 2021.

MATHEMATICS DEPARTMENT
Invited Talk
Department of Mathematics Conducted talk on ‘Machine Learning-Math behind the magic’ by Sri. Shankar Raman Sharma, Research Fellow, Indian Institute of Science.
Facilities
Department has well maintained research center where in research scholar can utilize the facilities computational assignments and projects.
Research
Department has seven doctorate holders and remaining faculty members are registered for doctorate program in different domain.
Department News
Department of Mathematics conducted One Day Workshop entitled “Applications of Biostatistics” on 26 th February, 2020.
Department Highlights
Dr. N V Vighnesam is instrumental in getting the project titled “Precise Orbit and Clock Estimation using NavlC Ground Reciever Data” of budget ₹32,28,000 from ISRO, the very first project to the Mathematics Department. ISRO has also Installed IRNSS receiver in DSCE Campus through this project.
Department Publications
Department of Mathematics encourages the faculty members to present and publish the papers in national and international journals. Around hundred papers are published in good, peer reviewed journals.

BT Alumni side
Admission Enquiry
Admission Details
CET Code:
E007 |
Comed-K Code:
E040 |
PGCET - MBA:
B158 |
M.Tech:
T822
The admission process at DSCE is through CET and COMEDK. The minimum requirement for Bachelor’s Degree (B.E) is pass in PUC / CBSE / ISCE /10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects and a minimum of 45% marks aggregate in Physics, Mathematics and any one of the following subjects: Chemistry / Biology / Biotechnology / Computer Science / Electronics and English as a compulsory subject.
Admission Procedure
The admission process at DSCE is conducted through common tests that are conducted by state agencies and national agencies like CET and COMMED-K. It commences in the month of March every year and concludes on 31st July of the same year. The lateral entry (Diploma Quota) through CET is for 3rd semester and commences in the month of July/August.
Course and Eligibility
B.E Programs
For UG, The admission to college is through the entrance test / Common Entrance Test (CET) conducted by Karnataka Government & Consortium of Medical, Engineering and Dental Colleges of Karnataka / COMEDK. The students with meritorious ranking are considered for admissions.
A pass in PUC/12th/10+2 or equivalent examination in the first attempt with Physics & Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with English as one of the subject/language.
A pass in PUC/12th/10+2 or equivalent examination with 45 % marks aggregate in Physics, Mathematics & any one of the following subjects: Chemistry / Biology / Computer science / Electronics.
Candidates belongs to Karnataka SC, ST & other backward classes (Cat-1, 2A, 2B, 3A & 3B) the minimum marks for the eligibility will be 40% aggregate in the optional subjects.
M.Tech Programs
A pass in B E/ B.Tech or equivalent examination.
A written test is conducted by the university for candidates and rank list is obtained. On the basis of which, the candidate will appear for admission carried out through single window counseling process.
Candidates with valid GATE score will be given first preference for the seat selection in the counseling process, then university rank holders.
MBA Program
For admission to Master of Business Administration (MBA) Program, the candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. PGCET Score is must for Government Quota Students.
However, in the case of candidates belonging to SC/ST and any other groups classified by the Government of Karnataka for such purpose from time to time, the aggregate percentage of marks in the qualifying examinations shall be not less than 45%.
M.Sc. Engineering/Ph.D
For Ph.D. The criteria for admission are through synopsis selection, ULRAT Test and an interview conducted by VTU for affiliated research centers.
Master's Degree of any recognized University or any other equivalent qualification.
All eligible applicants will be called for a written entrance test which has to be cleared to attend an interview. The admissions will be based on performance in the interview.
For M.Sc. Engg. Bachelor’s degree in the respective field is required, rest of the procedure is same as that foe Ph.D.
Master of Computer Application(MCA)
Admission to Master of Computer Application(MCA)Program, the candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. PGCET Score is must for Government Quota Students. The revised MCA course is for Two years or Four Semesters. This will be functional from the current academic year.
However, in the case of candidates belonging to SC/ST and any other groups classified by the Government of Karnataka for such purpose from time to time, the aggregate percentage of marks in the qualifying examinations shall be not less than 45%.
Admission through Management Quota
ENGINEERING:
Candidates should have passed with a minimum aggregate of 50% marks in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics (PCM) and should have passed these subjects individually. Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry are compulsory subjects.
MBA:
The candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. The students who have either taken PGCET, MAT, CAT or KMAT are eligible based on merit into the program.
Contact Us

Assistant Director Admissions

Course & Eligibility
Admission Enquiry
Course & Eligibility
B.E Programs
For UG, The admission to college is through the entrance test / Common Entrance Test (CET) conducted by Karnataka Government & Consortium of Medical, Engineering and Dental Colleges of Karnataka / COMEDK. The students with meritorious ranking are considered for admissions.
A pass in PUC/12th/10+2 or equivalent examination in the first attempt with Physics & Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with English as one of the subject/language.
A pass in PUC/12th/10+2 or equivalent examination with 45 % marks aggregate in Physics, Mathematics & any one of the following subjects: Chemistry / Biology / Computer science / Electronics.
Candidates belongs to Karnataka SC, ST & other backward classes (Cat-1, 2A, 2B, 3A & 3B) the minimum marks for the eligibility will be 40% aggregate in the optional subjects.
M.Tech Programs
A pass in B E/ B.Tech or equivalent examination.
A written test is conducted by the university for candidates and rank list is obtained. On the basis of which, the candidate will appear for admission carried out through single window counseling process.
Candidates with valid GATE score will be given first preference for the seat selection in the counseling process, then university rank holders.
MBA Program
For admission to Master of Business Administration (MBA) Program, the candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. PGCET Score is must for Government Quota Students.
However, in the case of candidates belonging to SC/ST and any other groups classified by the Government of Karnataka for such purpose from time to time, the aggregate percentage of marks in the qualifying examinations shall be not less than 45%.
M.Sc. Engineering/Ph.D
For Ph.D. The criteria for admission are through synopsis selection, ULRAT Test and an interview conducted by VTU for affiliated research centers.
Master's Degree of any recognized University or any other equivalent qualification.
All eligible applicants will be called for a written entrance test which has to be cleared to attend an interview. The admissions will be based on performance in the interview.
For M.Sc. Engg. Bachelor’s degree in the respective field is required, rest of the procedure is same as that foe Ph.D.
Master of Computer Application(MCA)
Admission to Master of Computer Application(MCA)Program, the candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. PGCET Score is must for Government Quota Students. The revised MCA course is for Two years or Four Semesters. This will be functional from the current academic year.
However, in the case of candidates belonging to SC/ST and any other groups classified by the Government of Karnataka for such purpose from time to time, the aggregate percentage of marks in the qualifying examinations shall be not less than 45%.
Admission through Management Quota
ENGINEERING:
Candidates should have passed with a minimum aggregate of 50% marks in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics (PCM) and should have passed these subjects individually. Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry are compulsory subjects.
MBA:
The candidates shall have passed the prescribed qualifying examinations with not less than 50% of the marks in aggregate of all the years / semesters of the degree examinations. The students who have either taken PGCET, MAT, CAT or KMAT are eligible based on merit into the program.

Examination
Home
>
Examination
Admission Enquiry
Examination Section
The Controller of Examinations (COE) is assisted by the Deputy Controller of Examination and other staff for conducting the examinations and publishing the results in time. The Examination Section is mainly responsible for the Conduct of various examinations, valuation of answer scripts and publication of results and Certificates.
The office of the COE is sensitized to the demands of the students, and holds their welfare in top priority. In the interest of the smooth running of all the processes of the COE office, which are vital to the proper functioning of the institute, a manual “Academic Rules and Regulations” has been compiled in which all the rules, regulations and procedures have been exhaustively laid out. This manual will serve as a useful ready- reckoner and help to clear doubts that may arise.
The Examination Section is aware of the need for reforms in traditional examination and assessment system and is continuously striving towards evolving a credible, valid, effective and transparent evaluation system that addresses the challenges and newer demands of the outside world.
We are continuously evolving by adopting technology to facilitate easy interface for exchange of information to all stakeholders.
Examination process is automated and comprises of setting Question Paper, Digital depository of answer scripts and Digital Evaluation in order to minimize time and make the entire process error free and efficient.
Regularly Orientation sessions are conducted to the faculty members on examination rules and regulations.
The rules and regulations governing the academic and assessment evaluation process will be disseminated to the students during induction program every year.
Strengthening the system to ensure that students have greater accessibility to processes that allow timely resolution of their problems.
To ensure the validity and stability of the examination system and work with the affiliating university.
Devise and monitor strategies and implementation of useful examination practices at the institute and continuously strive to bring about reforms as and when required in the examination system.

Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
Home

Placements
>
Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
Admission Enquiry
Placements
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has an elite placement division to facilitate the placements for all students. The Centre provides pre-placement training in soft skills to all students to enable them to apprise to the modern corporate requirements in association with
CIL - Centre for Innovation & Leadership
and
HR Division.
The Placement Division also supports training in
CV Writing, Aptitude Assessment, Mock interviews, Group Discussion
etc.,
Internship opportunities in various companies will be provided for interested UG/PG students.
DSCE is committed to provide best talent for corporates.
The Placement division works with Corporates to build the overall Development of Students as per industry requirements.
Number of Students placed in the Year
Message from Vice President - Placements
Mr. M N Guruvenkatesh
The Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has state of the art infrastructure for all departments. The excellent infrastructure of the University facilitates different activities of placement like pre-placement talks, Presentations, Online / written tests, Group discussions/ JMT, and interviews as per the requirements of the Companies. The centralized Placement cell have consistent placement records for the students from UG and PG programs that illustrates the commitment to the success of the Dayananda Sagar Group of Institutions.
I cordially invite all students to join our esteemed Institution for good placements and bright future. Also I cordially invite all prospective employers of our students to visit Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering and to participate in the on-campus placement process.
Contact Us
Mr. M N Guruvenkatesh
Vice President - Placements & Skill Development Centre
DAYANANDA SAGAR COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING
Shavige Malleshwara Hills,
Kumaraswamy Layout,
Bangalore 560 111, Karnataka, India.
Ph: +91 - 9844165956
Tel: +91 80 26663981 / 42161497
E-mail:
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Availability of Talents for Recruitment / Internships
BE / MTech – (CSE / ISE / ECE / EEE / Medical Electronics / Telecom / Instrumentation / Mechanical / IE & M / CIVIL / Construction Technology & Management / Chemical Engineering / Bio - Technology/ Architecture/ Automobile Engg/ Aeronautical Engg).
MCA, BCA, BSc (CS), BCom, BBM, MCom, D.Pharma, B.Pharma, M.Pharma, BSc & MSc (Nursing), BSc & MSc (Bio-Technology).
Diploma – (CSE / ISE / Mech / ECE / EEE / Civil)
The Placement Cell coordinates with recruiting companies and handles the entire end to end placement process.
The Training and Placement Cell is provided with a well-equipped Auditorium/ Seminar Hall for pre-placement talk, well-furnished rooms for training, interviews and counseling.
Few recruitment Partners

Placement Training
Home
>
Placements
>
Placement Training
Admission Enquiry
The Training and Placement Cell is provided with a well-equipped Auditorium/ Seminar Hall for pre-placement talk, well-furnished rooms for training, interviews and counseling. The Placement Cell coordinates with recruiting companies and handles the entire end to end placement process.
Placement Training activities
The Training and Placement Cell is also committed to enhance the employability skills of the students by organizing following training programs.
Organizing Aptitude training programs to enhance quantitative, verbal, logical & reasoning skills
Organizing soft-skills training to improve the student’s personality, Confidence level, Public Speaking skills, Conducting Mock Interviews, Group discussions.
Organizing subject/domain specific Technical Skills Training by Experts. Career counseling for pursuing higher studies.
Organizing entrepreneurship development programs to motivate the Students to become Entrepreneurs.
Training modules delivered
Goal-setting
Personality traits
Staying Positive
Self-motivation
Self-awareness
Learning skills
Effective communication skills
Time management
Interpersonal skills
Personal grooming
Emotional quotient
Body language
Human Relation
Creativity
Customer Relations Management
Team building
Problem solving and decision-making
Leadership skills
Public Speaking
Presentation skills
Negotiating skills
Self- management Cross-culture –communication and Corporate Culture
Interview / GD skills
Finance for Non - Finance
Sales training
Business etiquette
Managing stress
Share:

'A'
grade.

Campus Hiring
Home
>
Placements
>
Campus Hiring
Admission Enquiry
Campus Hiring
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has been working with many Companies for more than three decades for Students Internships and Placements. More than 100+ Companies have been visiting us every year for Campus Placements. We have signed
MOU
with more than 30+ Companies for helping students with projects Internships Industrial visits / Research / Placements. We have been achieving record placements over the years.
The Placement Cell coordinates with recruiting companies and handles the entire end to end placement process.

Placement Testimonials
Name: AchyuthSimha     Company: Kaleyra
Branch:
B.E., (ISE)
Salary:
6 LPA
Me I did not worry about getting placed from the beginning. I was always trying to be good in what I used to learn and it helped me to get this job.
Name: Amit Kumar Gupta     Company: OneDirect
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
20 LPA
The only thing that matter is passion towards whatever it is you're doing. Trying to learn something because you are interested in it and not for marks makes all the difference. As far as I am concerned, I hardly attended classes, sat in the last bench and had a mediocre GPA...but what mattered was my love for what I did.
Name: Ankit Kumar Singh     Company: Lowe’s India
Branch:
B.E., (ISE)
Salary:
8.48 LPA
I got placed in Lowe’s India and I am very happy with my placement. Placement office helped a lot and all my gratitude to the placement office of Dayananda Sagar College Of Engineering which helped us student to get placed in best companies in IT sector.
Name: ArjitSirmorya    Company: NCR Corporation
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
8.5 LPA
It was overall a great experience, all you need is to have good command on the basics and focus on what the company requirement is. There were three rounds that included two technical and one technical+HR, the interviewer was friendly and helpful. They also focused on how interested and dedicated I am toward working in the company and what was my previous research about the company.
Name: Arshad Nadeem     Company: Kaleyra
Branch:
B.E., (ISE)
Salary:
8 LPA
I studied for about half a month and coded for an hour or two daily. I cleared every coding interview that I sat for. Placements allowed me to enjoy coding again , overcome my fears during face to face interviews and also gave me the chance to join a company which was the best for me in terms of my growth and flexibility.
Name: BHARGAV B V     Company: OneDirect
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
20 LPA
I have always tried to upskill myself in every step of my college life by working on projects, internships and attending competitions like Hackathons. I also became the Student Lead at Developer Students Club which helped me teach a lot of students about the technologies. Apart from these I have always felt passionate about dancing which has kept me motivated every day. All of these have helped me to be prepared to secure a challenging position at One direct. I am very grateful to DSCE for giving me the best college experience, wonderful friends and memorable moments.
Name: Charu Srivastava     Company: Class method
Branch:
B.E., (ECE)
Salary:
22.7 LPA
Didn’t imagine I would be writing a “success story” someday. Cut short, after a lot of hurdles and support from family and friends, I have been campus placed and going to commence my corporate career soon in Tokyo (Japan) along with few other DSCEians. But I have learned the hard way. Before this, I was unable to convert successful written tests to respective placement offers that affected my confidence to be honest. But I never disheartened, rather I kept rectifying my mistakes from each failure and due to encouragement from my close ones. I tried a bit harder every next time, which eventually led my selection to Class method as an AWS engineer.
Name: DEEKSHITA SAVANUR     Company: Class method
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
22.57 LPA
DSCE has helped me land a job in Japan, I have always loved to travel and experience new cultures, which is why I was very excited when Zenken came on campus with multiple roles and companies. I went through many rounds in different companies but couldn’t get through a few. Although, I never gave up and kept applying. Finally, I got placed into Classmethod Inc. as an AWS engineer. I am excited to start my work in Tokyo next year and I’m having fun learning Japanese. This job would not only teach me new skills and ensure career growth, it will help me learn about a new culture and fulfill my travel quest.
Name: DEVASHISH SHUKLA    Company: MERCEDES Benz
Branch:
B.E., (ISE)
Salary:
6.2 LPA
It is rightfully said “Success is where preparation and opportunity meet”. Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering provided me with the opportunities that helped me in building my career and forming a better version of myself. I would like to thank my faculties, Head Of Department who helped me throughout the academics. The result of these four years of hard work came to me when I got placed at Mercedes Benz Research and Development India. For this I am highly thankful to the entire team of the Placement Department who provided me with the opportunity of getting placed in this great organization.

Name: Shravani Shirish Urankar     Company: NoesysSoftwares

Name: SOUJANYA DINNI     Company: Perfios
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
7 LPA
The interview was on 7th August 2019, it had 1 apti and coding test, 2 tech rounds and 1 HR, all on same day. I was happy for getting shortlisted towards further rounds. Interviewers were warm and friendly, which made us more comfortable to answer their questions confidently. By the end of day after all rounds, we got our results. Feels great to be placed in Perfios, and excited to work for same.
Name: MEHUL PODDAR     Company: Cisco Systems Pvt. Ltd
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
29 LPA
With the right kind of passion, you sit before a machine and the code writes itself. Programming for me – is not work, it's a hobby; right from translating silly childhood games with code to freelancing. Never content – constantly found the need to prove myself to myself. Landing an opportunity to interview with Cisco, I found myself competing against 90+ candidates from in and outside Bangalore having contrasting experiences in the field – candidates from the NITs, graduates from 2009 and so on.
Name: K R Vadiraj     Company: Amazon
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
19 LPA
Growing up in a family where expectations and standards are to be met, my journey towards success began. The oppressive feeling of guilt made me realize my self-worth. It was the constant zeal and motivation for my passion with sheer dedication and commitment that paved way to where I’m today. Leaving the world of denial to being more optimistic, I landed in my dream job. I’m thrilled to be a part of this ever-giving community. This journey is just the start of a new success story altogether.
Name: VenkatAnirudh S N     Company: Magnitude India Pvt Ltd
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
10 LPA
Magnitude was the 5th interview that I attended. Initially I found it very difficult to clear the technical rounds and in a few cases I was very close but ended up being rejected. This actually reduced my confidence level, nevertheless I never gave up. I realized that one should never give up; he/she will definitely get what he/she deserves. The only thing one must do is keep trying, learn from your mistakes and try to rectify it. In the end, I was extremely delighted on getting placed in magnitude.
Name: RACHAPALLI MUNINAIMISHA     Company: COGNIZANT SALESFORCE
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
5.2 LPA
I believe in “WHEN WE EXPECT MORE, WE ACHIEVE MORE”. To achieve something big hard work is the major factor, so put a goal and work hard for it. I’m really thankful for our college management for providing plenty of opportunities and great platform to showcase our talents.
Name: Navya Dua     Company: Breathbit
Branch:
B.E., (CSE)
Salary:
21 LPA
Placements are terrifying especially when you have given a try for more than two companies but could not even make it to the 1st round. I'm a student of CSE department. I got placed at ‘Breathbit’ as a Software developer. It was one of the best moments of my life. Here, learning wasn’t just learning. It was more than kicking off my preparation with aptitude test which was the first round and acing it among 150-200 students was the first step on the ladder. For the interview process in Breathbit, 12 among us were selected. For this I started with bracing up my resume and also brushed up my technical skills. I was put up with technical and situation based questions during the interview. When the results were declared, my happiness knew no bounds as I was one of those 2 selected.

Placements Contact
Home
>
Placements
>
Placements Contact
Admission Enquiry
Contact Us
The placement cell in the campus is actively working closely with the passing out students and companies looking out for fresh graduates. DSCE has a strong placement record with many of the passing out students receiving multiple offers from large corporates, year after year.
The Placement Cell coordinates with recruiting companies and handles the entire end to end placement process.
Contact us for Fresher’s Hiring : BE/ M.Tech / MCA/ MBA / BCA / BBA/ BSc / BCom / MCom/ Pharmacy / Life Sciences / Journalism & Mass communication / Diploma
Mr. M.N GURUVENKATESH
Senior Vice President - Placements & Skill Development ,
Dayananda Sagar Institutions Kumaraswamy Layout, Bangalore- 560 111.
Phone : +91 80 26663981 / 42161497 Mobile : +91 9844165956,
Mail :
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
,
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
, www.dayanandasagar.edu
Mr. NAGESH PURANIK
Director - Training & Placements
Dayananda Sagar Institutions Kumaraswamy Layout, Bangalore- 560 111.
Phone : +91 80 26663981 Mobile : +91 9739213552
Mail :
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
, www.dsce.edu.in

Research
Home
>
Research
Admission Enquiry
Research & Entrepreneurship
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) faculties and students regularly involve themselves in research activities related to various domains, we have Twenty (20) Research Centers which are approved by Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) in different branches of Engineering catering to research scholars for obtaining Ph.D.
Various Funded Research Projects
The faculties and students are involved in various research projects sponsored by various Goverment agencies as well as private organizations....
View More
Research Centers
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) has Twenty (20) Research Centers which are approved by Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) in different branches of Engineering catering to research scholars.....
View More
Innovation & Entrepreneurship Development Center
IEDC is the brain child of the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India and is closely monitored by The National Science & Technology Entrepreneurship Development Board (NSTEDB) in order to promote innovation and entrepreneurship among students in premier colleges which has the knowledge base and sufficient infrastructure....
View More
Derbi Foundation
In 2015, DERBI Foundation, the formal Incubation Centre was born... Since then, DERBI has been fueling the dreams of startups by enabling entrepreneurs to gather PACE , GALLOP business and EMERGE successfully through our pre-incubation, incubation and acceleration programs....
View More
List of Research Centers
Aeronautical Engineering
Automobile Engineering
Biotechnology
Chemical Engineering
Civil Engineering
Computer Science & Engineering
Construction Technology & Management
Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Electronics & Communication Engineering
Information Science & Engineering
Electronics And Instrumentation Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Medical Electronics
Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering
Engineering Chemistry
Engineering Mathematics
Engineering Physics
Master of Business Administration
Master of Computer Applications

About R & D
Admission Enquiry
About R & D
At Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE), Research and Development (R&D) stands at the heart of our vision to nurture innovation, creativity, and impactful knowledge creation. We believe that education goes beyond classrooms and textbooks—it thrives through curiosity, problem-solving, and real-world applications.
The R&D ecosystem at DSCE is designed to inspire students, faculty, and researchers to push boundaries, explore emerging technologies, and contribute solutions to societal and industrial challenges. With strong institutional support, state-of-the-art laboratories, and collaborations with industries and research organizations, DSCE fosters a culture where ideas are transformed into innovations.
Key Highlights of R&D at DSCE
Interdisciplinary Research: Encouraging collaboration across engineering, science, and management disciplines.
Funded Projects: Active participation in government and industry-sponsored projects from agencies such as DST, AICTE, DRDO, ISRO, VTU etc.
Innovation & Patents: Promoting intellectual property creation, with numerous patents, publications, and prototypes developed every year.
Research Centers of Excellence: Specialized centers focusing on cutting-edge areas like Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Renewable Energy, IoT, Nanotechnology, Biotechnology, and more.
Student Research Culture: Providing platforms for UG and PG students to engage in mini-projects, hackathons, startup incubations, and publications in reputed journals.
Global & Industry Collaboration: Partnerships with universities, research labs, and corporate R&D wings for knowledge sharing, consultancy, and real-time problem solving. Our Commitment
R&D at DSCE is not just about discovery—it is about impact. By blending academic rigor with industry relevance, we aim to empower our students and faculty to be thought leaders, innovators, and contributors to national and global progress.
Share:

Dean R&D Desk
Home
>
Research
>
Dean R&D Desk
Admission Enquiry
Dean R & D
Dr. Sriraam N
Dr. N. Sriraam, currently serving as Dean of R&D, Professor, and Head of the Department of Medical Electronics Engineering at DSCE, brings over 26.5 years of rich academic and research experience to the role. Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering His expertise spans wearable electronics, biomedical signal and image processing, and deep AI applications in healthcare. Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering with a PhD from Multimedia University (Malaysia) and an MTech (Biomedical Engineering) from Manipal, he has guided numerous PhD candidates, published prolifically in international journals, and led many sponsored research projects and patents. Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering as Dean R&D, Dr. Sriraam is committed to fostering a vibrant research ecosystem—promoting interdisciplinary collaborations, facilitating cutting‐edge innovation, and mentoring aspiring researchers and faculty to elevate DSCE’s research portfolio to global standards.
Dr. Sriraam N
Dean R & D, Professor
HoD - Medical Electronics Engineering

Research Centers
Admission Enquiry
Research Centers
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) has Twenty (20) Research Centers which are approved by Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) in different branches of Engineering catering to research scholars for obtaining Ph.D.
List of Research Centers
Aeronautical Engineering
Automobile Engineering
Biotechnology
Chemical Engineering
Civil Engineering
Computer Science & Engineering
Construction Technology & Management
Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Electronics & Communication Engineering
Information Science & Engineering
Electronics And Instrumentation Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Medical Electronics
Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering
Engineering Chemistry
Engineering Mathematics
Engineering Physics
Master of Business Administration
Master of Computer Applications
Information Science & Engineering
Electronics And Instrumentation Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Medical Electronics
Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering
Engineering Chemistry
Engineering Mathematics
Engineering Physics

DSCE Doctoral Fellowship 2025
Home
>
Research
>
DSCE Doctoral Fellowship 2025
Admission Enquiry
PhD Fellowship ( Full Time)
PhD Fellowship ( Full Time)
DSCE DOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP 2025
Applications are invited for Ph.D. Fellowship (Full Time) for the Academic Year 2025–26.
(Non-IT Branches: ₹35,000/- per month for the first two years and ₹40,000/- per month for the third year, IT Branches: ₹40,000/- per month for the first two years and ₹45,000/- per month for the third year)
Instruction
Application Form
Applications are Invited for Ph.D. Fellowship (Full Time) for the Academic Year 2024-25.
(Selected Ph.D. Scholars are eligible for Fellowship stipend of ₹ 25,000/-* per month for 3 year duration, subjected to conditions as laid out in guidelines.)
Notification
Guidelines
Application form
List of Research Centers
Aeronautical Engineering
Automobile Engineering
Biotechnology
Chemical Engineering
Civil Engineering

Construction Technology & Management

Electronics & Communication Engineering
Information Science & Engineering
Electronics And Instrumentation Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Medical Electronics
Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering

Engineering Physics

Various Funded Projects
Admission Enquiry
Various Funded Projects
DSCE has 20 Research Centers in different branches of Engineering catering to research scholars for obtaining PhD under VTU. The faculties and students are involved in various research projects sponsored by various Goverment agencies as well as private organizations.
Sl No.
Programme
Project Title
Funding Agency
Coordinator / PI / Co-PI
Total Grant
1
Biotechnology
Synergistic drug interactions to enhance the permeability and intracellular accumulation across the cytoplasmic membrane of M. tuberculosis
DST-SERB
Dr. Blessy Baby Mathew (P.I.)
15000 USD
2
Biotechnology
Development of a low-cost functional stack and incorporation of photocatalysis-derived column for water purification
KSCST- FPP
Dr. Blessy Baby Mathew (P.I.), Ms. Bhanu Revathi K. (Co-P.I.)
90,000
3
Biotechnology
Novel design and development of a filtration unit to convert floodwater to drinking resource using graphene-based nanocomposites
VGST-RGF
Dr. Blessy Baby Mathew (P.I.), Dr. K.S. Anantharaju (Co-P.I.)
3,00,000
4
Biotechnology
Biotechnology Skill Enhancement Programme (BiSEP)
Government of Karnataka
Dr. S. Kiran, Professor & Head
50 lakhs
5
CHEMICAL ENGG
Anaerobic fermentation studies on generation of hydrogen gas from crude glycerol
VGST
Prof. Priya s
05 Lakhs
6
Chemistry
Development of Waste Paper and Plastic Filled Polymer based composites: Waste to Wealth Approach
VGST, Govt. of Karnataka
Dr. K.S. Anantha Raju
60 Lakhs
7
Chemistry
Hybrid ferrite nano composites with enhanced visible light photocatalytic performance for next generation of clean
VTU TEQIP 3 , VTU
Dr. K.S. Anantha Raju
1.5 Lakhs
8
Civil

Dr. H.K. Ramaraju
19.96 Lakhs
9
Civil

14.35 Lakhs

Academic Council
Structure of Academic Council as per the statutes of UGC
Chairman:
Dr. B G Prasad - Principal
Members
(Experts from outside the College representing areas such as Industry, Commerce, Law, Education, Medicine, Engineering)
Members
(Teachers of the college representing different categories of teaching staff by rotation on the basis of seniority of service in the college)
Dr. Sudha K L,
Prof. E&C
Dr. Krishnan R,
Prof. CSE
Dr. Rudresh M,

NIRF
Home

Accreditation & Other approvals

NIRF
Admission Enquiry
National Institution Ranking Framework (NIRF)
The National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) was approved by the MHRD and launched by Honorable Minister of Human Resource Development.
This framework outlines a methodology to rank institutions across the country. The methodology draws from the overall recommendations broad understanding arrived at by a Core Committee set up by MHRD, to identify the broad parameters for ranking various universities and institutions. The parameters broadly cover
“Teaching, Learning and Resources,” “Research and Professional Practices,” “Graduation Outcomes,” “Outreach and Inclusive,” and “Perception”
.
DSCE applied to get approval from the National Institution Ranking Framework.
There are many parameters specified by NIRF to get Approval, as per that below are the list of documents provide by DSCE to get rank from the National Institution Ranking Framework.
Kindly send suggestions & feedback of your observations regarding NIRF to
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
2025
NIRF Engineering Complete report 2025
NIRF Management Complete report 2025
NIRF Over-all Complete report 2025
NIRF Innovation Complete report 2025
NIRF SDG INSTITUTION report 2025

NISP
Admission Enquiry
National Innovation and Startup Policy (NISP)
Objectives
Expert Committee
Activities
Collaborations and MOUs
IPR and Patents
Startup
NISP Policy Documents
Institution Innovation and Entrepreneurship Policy
Vision
To foster a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship that can be nurtured into viable business solutions for the benefit of the mankind.
Mission
To foster a culture of innovation in research and experiential learning.
To promote creation and commercialization of IP assets.
To create an environment for knowledge collaboration and co-creation towards strengthening business pathways.
Objectives
Create an environment to expose students to entrepreneurship and develop entrepreneurial characteristics or traits in students.
Provide the information to support the creation of an entrepreneurial learning environment.
To promote entrepreneurship through faculty innovative research projects.
To encourage faculty to take up entrepreneurial mentoring.
Create awareness of venture creation as a viable career option.
To create direct or indirect employment through the entrepreneur cell.
To bring awareness about IPR through regular expertise interaction and as part of the curriculum.
Expert Committee Meeting 2025
A meeting was conducted to review the activities of NISP at DSCE in the Board room.
Date:
07-02-2025
Time:
9.30 AM
Venue:
Board room, DSCE
Expert Committee Meeting
Agenda of the meeting:
Seed money applications – shortlisted through SIMSY/idea pitching/approval/disbursal
Status of FDPs sanctioned for 2024-25
Innovation Lab

Expert Committee Members 2021
A meeting was conducted for the formation of NISP committee in the Principal office.
Date:
17-02-2021
Time:
10.30 AM
Venue:
Principal office, DSCE
Agenda of the meeting:
Expert Committee formation (NISP)
The following members were nominated as the expert committee at DSCE to formulate the policy under NISP and to discuss the innovation and entrepreneurship activities under NISP.
Expert Committee Members
Activities
Innovation and Entrepreneurial activities were conducted in DSCE for creating an interest in students. Many eminent entrepreneurs and experts led the talks, workshops and hands on trainings in new technologies and discussed about the transformation of an engineer to an entrepreneur.
Activities 11
Activities 10
Activities 9
Activities 8
Activities 7
Activities 6
Activities 5
Activities 4
Activities 3
Activities 2
Activities 1
Collaborations and MOUs
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has entered into several collaborations and MOUs with reputed companies and National Institutes for research or conducting training in the fields of thrust areas and fields of mutual interests so as to benefit either way. A brief summary of the activities conducted under these MOUs are enlisted along with the details of the collaboration.
Collaborations and MOUs
IPR and Patents
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has several patents to its credit through the students and faculty unfolded from their collaborations and research with reputed companies and National Institutes. A brief summary of the details of the patents are enlisted along with the details of filing or publishing.
IPR and Patents 2024
IPR and Patents
Startup
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has few startups by its stake holders initiated through Innovation & Entrepreneurship Development Center (IEDC) and Dayananda Sagar Entrepreneurship Research & Business Incubation (DERBI) as student Start-up and Entrepreneurship. Details of the Startups in the DSCE campus are listed here.
Startup 2024
Startup 2023
NISP Policy Documents
National Innovation and Startup Policy initiated by MOE’s Innovation Cell is introduced in Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bangalore. The guidelines to initiate the related activities under NISP were approved and to be followed by the institution to pursue the innovation and startup activities of the stake holders.
Approval and I & E Policy DSCE
NISP 2019
Startup Policy Karnataka State
Startup policy DSCE

IIC

IIC
Admission Enquiry
Institution’s Innovation Council
Objectives
Expert Committee
Certificate
Reports
Linkage and Capacity Development
IIC
IA
Contact
Dayananda Sagar College of engineering has established the Institution’s Innovation council (IIC) as per the guidelines of MoE’s Innovation Cell (MIC) in the year 2020. The initiative was to create a vibrant local innovation ecosystem, start-up supporting mechanism, establish function ecosystem for scouting ideas and pre-incubation of ideas and to develop better cognitive ability for technology students.
Objective of IIC:
To conduct the various threshold activities throughout the year to generate the awareness, motivate and promote the innovation and enterpreneurship culture among students and faculty members in the campus.
Functions of IIC:
To conduct various innovation and entrepreneurship-related activities.
Identify and reward innovations and share success stories.
Organize workshops/ seminars/ interactions with entrepreneurs, investors, professionals and create a mentor pool for student innovators.
Network with peers and national entrepreneurship development organizations.
Create an Institution’s Innovation portal to highlight innovative projects carried out by institution’s faculty and students.
Organize idea competition with the involvement of industries.
Constitution of IIC Council
The first council meeting of Institution’s Innovation Council (IIC), Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering was held on 03/12/2021. DSCE-IIC President Dr. A. R. Aswatha Discussed the the formulation and function of IIC & shared roles and responsibility among newly joined council members as per the guidelines of MHRD’s Innovation cell. DSCE Institution’s Innovation Council (IIC) has representation of members from faculties, students and experts from regional ecosystem. The DSCE- IIC member’s details for the academic year 2021-2022 are as follows:

'A'
grade.

Approval Under UGC Section 2(f)
Share:
/documents/accreditations/ugc-2f
An Autonomous Institute Affiliated to VTU, Approved by AICTE & UGC
Accredited by NBA & NAAC with
'A'
grade.
CET Code:
E007 |
Comed-K Code:
E040
PGCET - MBA:
B158 |
M.Tech:
T822
PGCET - MCA:
C422

Prevention and Prohibition of Ragging
Home
>
Documents
>
Prevention and Prohibition of Ragging
Admission Enquiry
Prevention and Prohibition of Ragging
To: All Newly Admitted Students
Subject:
Prevention and Prohibition of Ragging in DSCE as per AICTE/UGC//GoK/VTU Regulations
As per the directives issued by
AICTE, UGC, VTU, and the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India
, ragging in any form is strictly
prohibited
in the premises of
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE), Bangalore
, including classrooms, hostels, canteens, buses, libraries, and any area of the campus.
Any student found indulging in
ragging or abetting
it, whether directly or indirectly, will face
strict disciplinary action
as per the existing rules and regulations. Punishments may include suspension, expulsion, debarring from academics/placements, cancellation of admission, and legal prosecution as applicable under law.
All students are hereby informed to:
Strictly refrain from any form of ragging
or harassment of fellow students—verbal, physical, or psychological.
Submit the Anti-Ragging Affidavit
(as per AICTE/UGC guidelines) duly signed by the student and parent/guardian at the time of admission/hostel allotment.
Attend anti-ragging awareness sessions
conducted during orientation and as scheduled by the college/hostel authorities.
Report immediately
to the Principal, Wardens, or Anti-Ragging Committee members if any incident of ragging is witnessed or experienced.
Support & Reporting:
The institution has constituted an
Anti-Ragging Committee and Squad
for proactive monitoring and handling of any complaints. All cases will be dealt with utmost confidentiality and seriousness.
Let us together make DSCE a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment for all.
For detailed rules, procedures, and affidavit formats, refer to the attached files:
>> AICTE/UGC/GoK/VTU Circulars on Ragging Prevention
Principal
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering
Bangalore – 560111
National Anti-Ragging Helpline
24x7 Toll Free
1800-180-5522
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
www.antiragging.in
UGC Monitoring Agency
Centre for Youth (C4Y)
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
www.c4yindia.org
RAGGING IS A CRIMINAL OFFENCE AND THE CULPRITS WILL ATTRACT PUNITIVE ACTION AS MENTIONED IN THE UGC REGULATIONS
(
www.antiragging.in/assets/pdf/annexure/Annexure-I.pdf)
Share:

Admission Enquiry
Hide Main content block
Admissions
The admission process at DSCE is through CET and COMEDK. The minimum requirement is pass in PUC / CBSE / ISCE /10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects and a minimum of 45% marks ...
read more
About DSCE
DSCE is an autonomous institute approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Govt. of India and affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University. It has widest choice of engineering branches ...
read more
Principal Message
It gives me immense pleasure to welcome you all to the creative world of DSCE with an eco-friendly campus coupled with state-of-art infrastructure. Our well-equipped labs, research centres, workshops and libraries help ...
read more
Examination Section
The evaluation process is carried out in two stages. Continuous Internal Evaluation [CIE] during the progress of the semester and Semester End Examination [SEE] conducted at the end of the semester ...
read more

Our Proud Alumni
Departments
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) offers a wide range of academic programs Undergraduate (UG), Postgraduate (PG), Research (Ph.D.) programs across various disciplines. These programs are designed to foster innovation, research, and professional excellence in engineering and allied fields.
Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
Aeronautical Engineering
Automobile Engineering
Biotechnology
Chemical Engineering
Civil Engineering
Computer Science and Engineering
Computer Science Engineering (Cyber Security)
Computer Science Engineering(Data Science)
Computer Science and Engineering (IoT & Cyber Security Including Blockchain Technology)
Computer Science and Design
Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Electronics & Communication Engineering
Information Science & Engineering
Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Medical Electronics Engineering
Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering
Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
Master of Business Administration
Master of Computer Applications
Mathematics Department
Physics Department
Chemistry Department
HIGHLIGHTS
NAAC A & NBA Accredited Programs
DSCE holds NAAC A accreditation and multiple NBA-accredited UG programs, reflecting excellence in quality education, infrastructure, and academic outcomes.
Autonomous Institution Affiliated to VTU
DSCE is an autonomous college under Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU), offering a dynamic and industry-relevant curriculum aligned with global standards.
Strong Placement Record
Our dedicated placement cell has facilitated over 1,500+ placement offers annually, with top recruiters including TCS, Infosys, Accenture, Bosch, SAP, and more.
Active Research and Innovation Culture
DSCE promotes interdisciplinary research and innovation through its state-of-the-art research centers, funded projects from DST, AICTE, VGST, and industry collaborations.
Center of Excellence & Industry Tie-ups
Centers of Excellence in AI/ML, IoT, EV, Robotics, and VLSI are supported by collaborations with industries such as Texas Instruments, Intel, Bosch, and IBM.
International Collaborations
MoUs with reputed global universities in the USA, Germany, UK, and Japan enable student/faculty exchange, joint research, and global exposure.
Incubation & Start-up Support
DSCE’s Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Cell (IEDC) and DSCE Innovation Hub have nurtured 50+ startups and received national recognition from institutions like MSME and Atal Innovation Mission.
Holistic Student Development
A vibrant campus life with over 40+ technical and cultural clubs, student chapters like IEEE, SAE, ISTE, and regular technical fests fosters leadership and teamwork.
Green and Technology-Enabled Campus
DSCE offers a lush green, Wi-Fi-enabled campus with smart classrooms, advanced labs, e-learning platforms, and digital libraries.
Social Commitment and Sustainability
DSCE engages in impactful community outreach through NSS, Rotaract, and Unnat Bharat Abhiyan programs, and drives campus-wide green initiatives aligned with UN SDGs.

Admission Enquiry
Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Center(IEDC)
ABOUT IEDC
IEDC ACTIVITIES
INNOVATION at IEDC
PREINCUBATION
UPCOMING PROGRAMS
GALLERY
CONTACT
Sowing the seeds for self-employment & income generation
Dayananda Sagar institutions are producing large number of trained manpower, thus fulfilling the needs of the industry, R&D institutions and other sectors of economy. In order to make optimal use of facilities, expertise and know-how available in these institutions for the benefit of the society, it is necessary that appropriate links be established between them and the industry. In addition, young graduates are also looking out for opportunities to exploit their full potential by setting up their own ventures. This necessitates systematic interventions and new instruments, which could facilitate the development and growth of new ventures by fresh graduates. Thus, it is necessary to develop mechanisms so that we could focus our attention on entrepreneurship & self-employment.
Excellent infrastructure is available at our campus for promoting Entrepreneurship.Trained faculty and focused programs inculcate entrepreneurial spirit amongst the Science, Technology and management students.
Empowerment through Entrepreneurship
The Dayananda Sagar institutions, which are leaders in developing human resources, have now taken up to produce entrepreneurs on a continuous basis, who would be employment generators, there by accelerating  the process of economic development and growth of our country.
With the increasing number of graduating students from the institutions, it is our social responsibility and concern to provide them alternate career options. Along with preparing them to be employable, it is also important to develop ‘Job creators’ than ‘Job seekers’. It is therefore necessary to motivate and train young students to take up self-employment. Hence there is a crucial need to promote Entrepreneurship among science, technology and management students. At DSI IEDC, we are undertaking this role of blending their technical inputs with entrepreneurial and managerial skills and train students for entrepreneurial challenges. Entrepreneurs are not only born, but also made.
PARTICIPATING INSTITUTIONS:
All the students, Alumni, faculty & staff of institutions under DSI spread across the three campuses are welcome to participate in the IEDC activities.
ORGANIZATION:
Patrons
: Chairman, Vice-Chairman and Secretary
Advisory
board
: An advisory board will be formed consisting of experts from academia, industries, professional societies, R&D institutions, Alumni and leading entrepreneurs. The advisory board meets every year and reviews policies, procedures and activities of the IEDC
Managing Committee
: Heads of institutions/ departments of various programs of three campuses under DSI form the managing committee. The managing committee will meet every three months and contribute in terms of student participation, faculty expertise for mentoring and extending lab facilities for incubates.
Faculty in charge along with staff and student Coordinators
at IEDC will monitor & execute the proposed activities.
VISION
To create, mentor & nurture entrepreneurs who in turn create employment opportunities, contribute for the economy of the society and nation at large.
MISSION:
Our Mission is to mentor students and start up entrepreneurs with brilliant minds in harvesting their ideas that revolutionize an industry or even create an industry.
ABOUT IEDC
History of ED Initiatives @ DSCE...
In the year 2012 IEDC was established in DSI as an initiative to mentor innovative ideas from students and nurture them to become entrepreneurs.
IEDC is the brain child of the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India and is closely monitored by The National Science & Technology Entrepreneurship Development Board (NSTEDB) in order to promote innovation and entrepreneurship among students in premier colleges which has the knowledge base and sufficient infrastructure.
DSI is one of the esteemed Host Institutions to have been selected as Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre.
OBJECTIVES
To expose the students to challenging industrial scenario and highlight the importance of entrepreneurs in the economic growth of the country.
To induce the spirit of entrepreneurship among the students and also train them to improve their entrepreneurial and managerial competence & skills.
Industry- institute interaction in the form of training and incubation.
Induction Report
PROPOSED ACTIVITIES
Pre-incubation:
Student startups are encouraged. Startups from outside are also encouraged with a condition that they hire at least two interns from DSI.
IDEATHON:
Ideate, Innovate, Improve, Implement; Platform to showcase students creative ideas here.
E-Summit:
2 day mega event to ‘Nurture Entrepreneurship’ right from Ideation to build business plan/model. Includes 3-4 workshop, various competitions, Flee marketing
One day Workshop:
Related to Entrepreneurship
Processing of MSME-BI proposal:
GOI support Startups by funding and providing incubation to their ideas.
E-Cell activities:
CEO connect, Alumni Entrepreneur interaction, E-Competitions

GUIDELINES FOR PRE-INCUBATION
The incubation center has co working space with well-equipped board/meeting room, an office with phone, printing/photocopying, Wi-fi, drinking water and rest room facilities.
DSI students who come with an idea which has a potential for becoming a commercially viable product can apply for incubation.
Aspiring entrepreneurs from outside are also encouraged to apply for incubation provided they ensure hiring at least 2 DSI students as interns.
Proposal for the same will be scrutinized by a technical team and after interview; decision for incubation will be taken.
After selection incubates have to sign an agreement in the prescribed format and fill a registration form.
DSI Pre-incubation center at 7
th
Floor, New Engineering Block has the following 5 startup companies with 9 seats in total.
Companies - December 2020

Activities of 2020-21
On 7thSeptember, Ms. Maithreyi S of III year student of E&C Dept. and also an E-cell student has successfully conducted the Online Session on “Ideation”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship.19 DSCE Students were participated in the event
On 7th September, Mr. Anish Singhal of II year student of CSE Dept. and also an E-cell student have successfully conducted the Online Session on “Brainstorming”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 14 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 8th September, Mr. Sourabh Konkala of II year student of ECE Dept. and also an E-cell student have successfully conducted the Online Session on “Planning”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 9 DSCE Students were participated in the event..
On 8th September, Mr. Sai Abhishek Babu J S of III year student of ECE Dept. and also an E-cell student has successfully conducted the Online Session on “Strategy Planning”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 9 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 9th September, Mr. Yash Raj Banka of III year student of ISE Dept. and also an E-cell student have successfully conducted the Online Session on “Capital”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 14 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 9th September, Mr. Yash Raj Banka of III year student of ISE Dept. and also an E-cell student have successfully conducted the Online Session on “Marketing and Sale”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 8 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 10th September, Mr. Hardik Anirudh of II year student of ECE Dept. and also an E-cell student has successfully conducted the Online Session on “Team”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 12DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 11th September, Ms. Trushika Arya of III year student of CSE Dept. and also an E-cell student has successfully conducted the Online Session on “Launch”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 12 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
On 11th September, Ms. Esha Gupta of III year student of ECE Dept. and also an E-cell student have successfully conducted the Online Session on “Goal”, which is one among the nine stages of Entrepreneurship. 12 DSCE Students were participated in the event.
• On 13th September, a live talk with Kshitij Doval, Founder of @unhu_school and @saleforbrands gave live session hosted By IEDC E-cell Students in the Instagram platform @iedc_dsi.
On 15th September, a live talk with Gaurav Shrishrimal, Co-founder of Kaagaz Scanner, gave live session hosted By IEDC E-cell Students in the Instagram platform @iedc_dsi.
From 15th to 23rd October, Prof. Roopa Farshi has attended a 9-day Programme 'KAPILA: Kalam Program for IP Literacy and Awareness' organized by Ministry of Education (MoE), Innovation Cell and received certificate after successfully passing the Assessments.
From 15th to 23rd October, Prof. Roopa Farshi has attended a 9-day Programme 'KAPILA: Kalam Program for IP Literacy and Awareness' organized by Ministry of Education (MoE), Innovation Cell and received certificate after successfully passing the Assessments.
From 16th to 18th December, Prof. Roopa Farshi has participated in the International web symposium on Technology and Management conducted by Visvesvaraya Technological University in collabaration with Aspire for her Foundation.
On 18th December, as a part of IIC activities, department of Chemical Engineering and Biotechnology has organized an orientation sessionon Innovation and Entrepreneurship. Students and faculty members of both the department were attended the program.
On 21st December 2020, Prof. Roopa Farshi gave an orientation talk on IEDC and its facilities at DSCE, in an induction program conducted for the first year students of academic year2020-21. by IEDC. Total 158 first year Students from different branches were atended the program along with coordinators of Induction.
