STC
Admission Enquiry
Space Technology Cell (STC)
ABOUT
MEMBER
INITIATIVE
ACTIVITIES
DSCE and ISRO signed a MoU to establish STC in the DSCE on April 29
th
at ISTRAC, Peenya, Bangalore.
Motivation for the STC
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bangalore, Karnataka, India, and the Indian Space Research Organization, Government of India, recognized the friendly relations between the two agencies and their willingness to cooperate in the area of academia as a common interest for establishing the Space Technology Cell, considering the mutual benefits and the need to strengthen cooperation within the field of Space Science and Technology.
This initiative, aims at promoting and strengthening scientific & technical exchange and cooperation between scientists, engineers of ISTRAC, and academicians and students of DSCE in the field of Space Science and Technology.
Vision:
To strengthen the milieu of academic alliance, making it  the place of choice to work and grow, by fostering  intellectuals in the creation of novelty in Space Science and Technology.
Mission:
Enhancement of Students’ knowledge and skills leading to the advances in Space Industry.
Augmenting faculty contribution towards R&D and innovation in Space Technologies.
All endeavors of the cell to lay emphasis on welfare of the society / man-kind
Long term objective:
Development of Satellite based technologies and to own a students’ satellite to demonstrate their capabilities and thereby improve upon the societal benefit
OBJECTIVE:
Cooperative institutional relationship to encourage the faculty and students towards the Space Science & Technology
Evolve in to an institute to design and develop a Satellite.
Functional Modalities:
Exchange and training of scientific and technical personnel
Exchange of available scientific and technological information and data
Implementation of education and training programs in the institution related to space communication
Organizing of workshops, seminars for the working groups
Transfer of equipment, know-how, and technology and technical standards on a non-commercial basis
Development of joint research or technical projects on subjects of mutual interest
Exchange visits by Government officials and technical experts for sharing of experiences on space communication, policies, frameworks, and technologies
Promoting space-related education and innovation
ISTRAC
Mr B N Rama Krishna   Director, ISTRAC
Mr M R Raghavendra   Deputy Director, ISTRAC
Mr Sreenath   ISRO Scientist   Nodal Officer STC   Manager, ISSDC, ISTRAC
DSCE
Dr Smitha Sasi  Associate Professor   Chair-STC SPOC
Student Satellite Launch Initiative:
We are proud to share that the
Space Technology Cell,Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering,
has signed an
MoU with Gonagoor Technology
for the development of an
Aerial and Orbital Satellite
. Upcoming launch of
DSCE Student Satellite
“Vishnu Chakra” in November 2025, in collaboration with Gonagoor Technologies and ISTRAC,
Sathish Dhawan Space Centre
Sriharikota. This prestigious project is a collaborative effort involving the following departments: Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, MCA (VTU),Data Science (CSE) ,Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Aeronautical Engineering
This initiative is expected to bring nationwide recognition to our institute and showcases our interdisciplinary strength in driving cutting-edge space technology.
Target Launch Date of Satellite : Second week of November 2025
This initiative is expected to bring
nationwide recognition
to our institute and showcases our interdisciplinary strength in driving cutting-edge space technology.
Report of the Activities under STC – DSCE -ISTRAC
Space Technology Cell (STC) in association with ISRTAC, Bangalore is established in the department of ETE, DSCE for which the MOU was signed on 29
th
April 2024 at ISTRAC centre.
Infrastructure set up for STC at DSCE
is in process. Request mail to all the
Directors of ISRO centres and New Space India Ltd across India has been sent for procuring
Satellite Sub System Elements
for the cell.
For this Cell, all the Satellite Models launched by ISRO are procured as given below:  o MANGALAYAAN 1:30  o CHANDRAYAAN 1:30  o OCEAN SAT 1:30  o CARTO SAT 1:30  o RESOURCE SAT 1:30  o PSLV …. to impart the awareness of various satellite launched by ISRO
Internship/project:
Three students from the Department of Information Science and Engineering have been selected to carrying out Project in U R Rao Satellite Centre on “
GUI based data analysis for Class Data from Chandrayaan
” Dr.Shyama Narendranath Scientist,U R Rao satellite Centre. The students are working on the software for the same, which will bear the name of the institute on the website of ISRO as
“Powered by DSCE” in ISRO Website.
Students from the Department of AI Ml and Three Data Science pursuing internship on
Disaster management Data analysis in “BHUVAN” portal ,NRSC Centre
Three students from department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering doing 6 months project in
Anamonly detection on the datas received by the isro satellites using deep learning and Debris
,ISTRAC  under Ms Priyanaka,scientist ,ISTRAC
Discussion with a company named Indo-Science and ISRO are in progress to train the students of
DSCE
for the
“launch of Student Satellite”.
Students from departments of ETE, ISE, AI-ML, Mechanical and Aeronautical along with one faculty coordinator have been identified for the training.
First round of orientation and Project selection has been conducted with the scientists and employees of Indo – Science Company with the faculty coordinators and some students.
On February 20th, 2025 the Space Technology Cell conducted a presentation on satellite design, where teams from AI/ML, ME, EEE, Data Science, and Aeronautical departments presented their ideas. The ISRO scientists and the Indo-Science team reviewed the proposals, and among the three proposed ideas, "
OceanScan
" was identified as the most feasible. This idea was proposed by Madhuri, a 3rd-semester Data Science student.

CIL

Innovation

CIL
Admission Enquiry
Centre for Innovation and Leadership (CIL)
CIL - is established in the year 2006 under the banner of DSI to bridge the gap between pure academics and the corporate realities. The Centre aims to impart innovative soft skill training programs to enable individuals to become champion leaders in their endeavor, and to sustain a high level of performance at the individual and the organizational level.
CIL recognizes the challenge of unleashing the potential of individuals to transform them to achieve excellence. To face the challenge, CIL is armed with eminent Academicians, Coaches, Mentors and Thinkers with hands on experience in the corporate world to design high quality training modules. The primary aim of all the training modules would be to allow individuals to take control of their lives by re-discovering their potential.
Soft Skills
In order to be versatile and successful in today's dynamic business environment, one need to have good credentials with the realization those academics is just one face of the coin. There is a growing need to learn various Soft Skills, which form an integral part of one's overall personality to improve one's own effectiveness. These additional skills sets are highly useful in the long run to build effective teams. By augmenting the existing academic knowledge, one will be able to gain significant advantage to gain a clear edge in the market place.
Induction
Induction training is an innovative device, which helps to make the students to get familiarize with the institution’s culture. Every new inductee needs to be in tune with the institution culture and the training provided to him/ her needs to be more so aligned with the course needs.
Continuous Soft Skills
This Centre aims to give high quality Soft skills training program keeping in view the globalization process and is scheduled throughout the course of various disciplines such as - Engineering, Management, Diploma in Technical Education and Information technology of DSI. Every semester various modules are delivered by our expert trainers.
Pre - Placement & Placement Training
Placement training plays a key role in a student's career. In order to stand out in the present competitive world, students require excellent functional skills, Leadership and Managerial skills and an exceptional outlook. In today's vibrant job market, organizations seek talents who have both technical and interpersonal skills. Participating in placement training enable the students to know where they stand and where they need to improve.
Events Conducted by CIL
CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT AND SKILL ENHANCEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR IMPROVING STUDENT CAPABILITY
Student Capability Enhancement Activities for the year 2023-24
Student Capability Enhancement Activities for the year 2022-23
Student Capability Enhancement Activities for the year 2020-22
Communication Skills
iTell Software:
The college has installed iTell software in 2018 in the Digital Library procured from iTell software Consultant from Calicut, Kerala. The students will be trained in various modules in the English Language Lab which enhances their English communication skills. All the first year engineering students were the beneficiaries of the iTell software. The Software consists of various audio-visual and reading exercises related to the English language. Usage of this software on a daily basis helps the students to improve their reading, writing, listening and speaking skills. The faculty members are also given a thorough training on the usage of the software.
Language Lab
The Language Lab is a place where we have different tools and materials to practice and improve our skills and also to learn the language. Language lab enhances the skills of a student, teaches English and improves the ability to Listen, Speak, Read and Write. To improve the skills in any language, one must listen and speak in order to follow the system of that language.
Soft - Skills “An Essential Ingredient for Success”
An Online Webinar on Soft Skills for the first year engineering students was organized by the Department of Physics & Humanities on 28th May 2021. The resource person, Dr. Kalpana Singh from the Department of Humanities, presented a talk on the nuances of different qualifying skills necessary for up grooming students' overall personality. The objective of the webinar was to introduce different qualities and skills to the students, right at the beginning of their undergraduate program, so that they can understand the importance of different soft skills necessary for their successful personal, academic, social and professional life and inculcate them for their betterment.
The presentation began with the introduction to the soft skills; as the skills, abilities and traits that pertain to personality, attitude and behavior, and how it influences an individual's interaction with others. The knowledge of different important skills which qualify as soft skills such as; communication skills, interpersonal skills, emotional intelligence, team work, problem solving skills, time management, creativity, leadership skills, conflict management, ability to work under pressure, personal grooming….etc. and how these qualifying skills come under different types of soft skills - Personal skills, Social skills and Methodical skills were highlighted.

KSTA Institutional Membership

KSTA Institutional Membership
Admission Enquiry
KSTA (Karnataka Science and Technology Academy)
Institutional Membership Certificate
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) is proud to be an
Institutional Member of the Karnataka Science and Technology Academy (KSTA),
a prestigious autonomous organization dedicated to nurturing scientific temperament, strengthening research culture, and promoting academic excellence across higher education institutions in Karnataka.
DSCE has been enrolled as a
KSTA Institutional Member for a tenure of 10 years,
ensuring sustained academic, research, and professional development opportunities for our students and faculty members.
About KSTA
The Karnataka Science and Technology Academy (KSTA) functions as a premier autonomous body that supports innovation, research initiatives, capacity building, and scientific outreach among academic institutions, researchers, and young scientists. Through funding support, collaborative programs, and access to specialized resources, KSTA plays a vital role in strengthening the state’s science and technology ecosystem.
Key Benefits of KSTA Institutional Membership
1.  Financial Assistance for Research
Grants ranging from
₹25,000 to ₹50,000
Support for
students and young scientists undertaking short-term research projects
Encouragement for early-stage research and innovation activities
2.  Collaborative Academic Programs
Opportunity to organize
joint workshops, seminars, and conferences
in collaboration with KSTA
Programs conducted on a
cost-sharing basis
, enhancing outreach and academic impact
3.  Faculty Development Opportunities
Faculty members can enroll as
Associate Members of KSTA at a nominal membership fee
Access to professional development programs, expert interactions, and academic networks
4.  Concessions and Discounts
Discounted registration fees
for students and faculty for KSTA-sponsored training programs
Access to
subsidized KSTA publications
and academic resources
5.  Access to KSTA Infrastructure
Use of
KSTA auditorium and audio-visual studio
Facilities available at
concessional rates
for academic and research-related events
Institutional Impact
The KSTA Institutional Membership significantly strengthens DSCE’s commitment to: - Promoting
research- driven learning
- Enhancing
faculty and student research capabilities
- Encouraging
inter-institutional collaboration
- Supporting
innovation, scientific inquiry, and professional growth
Through this long-term association with KSTA, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering continues to create a vibrant academic environment that empowers students and faculty to contribute meaningfully to science, technology, and societal development.
This
membership reflects DSCE’s ongoing dedication to excellence in education, research, and innovation.
Share:

For E-Resources Click Here...
Faculty members and students of DSCE are here by informed to note that, the library has made additional services in accessing of E-books from your desktop inside the campus. To access click on the URL:
http://172.25.30.206:8080/jopacv11.
Library
Vision
Library serves as a resource centre and aims to develop a comprehensive collection of books and journals useful for faculty and students of the institute and provides an efficient dissemination of knowledge.
Mission
Library aims to be one of the best among engineering college libraries in the country.
Library intends to incorporate the latest technology and adopt a user friendly approach towards students and faculty.
Library intends to offer comprehensive services related to diffusion of knowledge.

Library Brochure
CLICK HERE...
About Us
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has built up a reputation of higher academic standards in all specialties of Engineering for three decades now, a true reflection of dedication and hard work. One of the pillars of such high standards is its high-quality Library facilities. This college's academic excellence is reflected in its harmonious blend of Infrastructure and its academic environment with high quality Library. The Library facilities here are state-of-the-art following the latest automated RFID technology and Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering is the first Private sector Engineering College in India to install this system. This latest system is user friendly and provides access to any book available in few minutes. The Library has a huge collection of over a lakh Books & E-books, along with CD's and DVD's apart from latest Journals and Periodicals.
Evident from the acknowledgements and positive remarks by the visiting faculty and dignitaries, the intellectual standards of Dayananda Sagar Engineering are truly reflected in its high standard Library. This Library is accessible to all Undergraduates, Postgraduates, and PhD scholars of different Specializations and also to the Faculty. Along with this, access to e-Books and e-journals is also available through the Digital Library with dedicated systems. It has also a mini auditorium designed for seminars, Academic Presentations and other educational activities.
Our Library consists of skilled, professional and compassionate staff members who are always pleased to help the users.

Kindle E - book
Admission Enquiry
For e-Resources Click Here...
Faculty members and students of DSCE are here by informed to note that, the library has made additional services in accessing of E-books from your desktop inside the campus. To access click on the URL:
http://172.25.30.206:8080/jopacv11.
Kindle E-book
Brief Report on Kindle E-book Reading Zone
Kindle e book reading zone was inaugurated by Mr. Rohan Prem Sagar, Joint Secretary, DSI and Member of Governing Council, DSCE. Dr.CPS Prakash Principal, DSCE, Dr, Ashwath, Dean and HOD Telecommunication department, Dr. J. C David, Chief Librarian and all staff of Main Library were present on this occasion.
The Kindle E Book Readers are having the following features :
Subscribed amazon E-Books
More Than 70,000 nos. of e- books available
9 Languages
Multiple subjects covered- including light reading and rare book
No Eye Strain, Reads like Real Paper
Text Read and Listen option through the Blue Tooth Device
Supported by Dictionary and Wikipedia
Note and Highlight option
User friendly operations.
Gallery:
Share:
/facilities/library/kindle-e-book

Sports & Fitness
Admission Enquiry
Sports & Fitness
DSCE encourages students to explore their latent talents by providing World Class Sports and Games facilities. The institute is equipped with the following.
Indoor Sports
CARROMS
CHESS
MODERN GYMNASIUM
TABLE TENNIS
TWO INTERNATIONAL LEVEL SQUASH COURTS
VOLLEYBALL COURT
GYM FACILITY
SQUASH COURT
TABLE TENNIS
CARDIO EQUIPMENTS AT GYM
OUTDOOR SPORTS
BASKETBALL COURT
CRICKET PRACTICE PITCH
FOOTBALL FIELD
SYNTHETIC TENNIS COURT
THROWBALL COURT
YOGA / AEROBIC HALL
BASKETBALL COURT
SYNTHAETIC TENNIS COURT
FOOTBALL FIELD
STADIUM GALLERY & OUTDOOR PLAYGROUND
VOLLEYBALL COURT
Year wise Sports Reports
2022-23
2021-22
2019-20
Achievements
Ms.Gilbert Leititia, I Year student (Cyber Security) won Silver medal (Fencing/Seniors) in CM Cup Dasara Sports Meet 2023.
Dr.C.P.S Prakash,Principal DSCE and Mr.Nanjundaswamy, Physical Education Director receiving the prestigious “Best Performing Institute” Cash award (Rs-1,00,000/-) for promotion of sports activities from V T U Vice- Chancellor on Achievers Day Ceremony held on 19th October-2019
Sri. Galiswamy, Secretary Dayananda Sagar Institutions, Dr. C.P.S Prakash, Principal DSCE, congratulating Shriya R Bhat, 2nd SEM- Bio Tech- for achieving 5 Gold medals in swimming at Revels’20 National Cultural and Sports Fest Organized by Manipal Institute of Technology from 4th to 7th-March-2020.
Vaibhav Patil, 7th SEM- CTM Secured 2nd place in 100m & 200m Run in VTU Inter Collegiate Athletic Meet organized by S J C Institute of Technology from 22nd to 25th October-2019.
Mr.Rahul, 7th SEM-ISE, Secured 1st Place in 75 kg category in VTU-Best-Physique Competition, at Sri Sai Ram College of Engineering On 14th & 15th October-2019.
Mr.Rahul,7th SEM–ISE, Secured 3rd place in Dasara Shree – 2019, Body building competition at Mysore, on 3rd & 4th October-2019.
Football Men’s team were Runner up in Kreedotsava, organized by BMS College of Engineering, from 1st to 4th October-2019.
Swimming Women’s team bagged Championship in VTU State Level Inter Engineering College Swimming competition for Men & Women, Organized by MSRIT on 18th Sep-2019
ShriyaBhat-1st SEM–Bio Tech- Secured 2-Gold, 4-Silver Medals
Nandini .S.S- 1st SEM- CSE, Secured 2- Gold, 2- Silver, 2-Bronze Medals
Rishab.C.Shirur – 3rd SEM -CSE, Secured 1- Gold, 1- Silver Medal in VTU State Level Inter Engineering College Swimming competition for Men & Women, organized by MSRIT on 18th Sep-2019.
Table Tennis Men‘s team were Runner up in VTU Inter collegiate Zonal & Inter Zonal Tournament, Organized by BMS College of Engineering, from 1st to 5th October-2019.
Throwball Women’s team were runner up in Bhavana Memorial Inter Collegiate Throwball Tournament, Organized by GAT, on 17th October-2019.
Volleyball Women’s team were Runner up in Kreedotsava, Organized by BMS College of Engineering from 1st to 4th October-2019.
Volleyball Men’s team secured 3rd place in VTU Inter Collegiate Tournament Organized by GAT, on 3rd & 4th March-2020.
Chetan.B.Rao-7th _ EC Secured 1st place in Judo under-66 kg category in VTU Inter Collegiate Competition organized by S J C College of Engineering on 6th & 7th September-2020.
University Representation
The following Students have represented VTU in different Sports held during-2019-20
Rishab.C.Shirur – 3rd -SEM-CSE, represented VTU Aquatic team (Men & Women) in All India Inter- University Championship held at Lovely Professional University, Punjab from 1st to 8th November-2019
Shriya.R.Bhat – 1st –SEM-Bio-Tech, represented VTU Aquatic team (Men & Women) in All India Inter- University Championship held at Lovely Professional University, Punjab from 1st to 8th November-2019
Nandini.S.S -1st -SEM-CSE, represented VTU Aquatic team (Men & Women) in All India Inter- University Championship held at Lovely Professional University, Punjab from 1stto 8th November-2019
M-Karthik-6th-SEM-ISE, represented VTU Baseball team in All India Inter University Competition scheduled at Royal Global University, Guwahati (Assam)

Counselling Center
Home
>
FACILITIES
>
Counselling Center
Admission Enquiry
Counselling Center
At DSCE,
Counselling Center
is dedicated to supporting students with challenges related to emotional and mental well-being, academic stress, and other personal concerns. The sessions are conducted on a
one-to-one basis
, allowing students to openly share their difficulties in a safe, confidential, and supportive environment.
Each counselling session typically lasts
45–60 minutes
, with the frequency and follow-up depending on the student’s individual needs, goals, and progress. While some concerns can be addressed through short-term counselling, more complex issues may require periodic follow-up sessions to ensure gradual and sustained improvement. Students seeking help are scheduled for the earliest available appointment.
Counselling services are provided by
qualified counsellors, licensed psychologists, and therapists
, who approach every student with empathy, respect, and non-judgment, ensuring complete confidentiality.
The counsellor’s role is to:
Help students cope with crisis situations and reduce distress.
Support personal growth and overall well-being.
Assist in reshaping thought patterns, emotional responses, and behaviours.
Set clear, achievable goals to track and encourage progress.
Outcome of Counselling
Through counselling, students are able to:
Develop effective coping skills.
Improve decision-making abilities.
Strengthen interpersonal relationships.
Experience positive changes, often within just a few sessions, with sustained improvement through follow-ups where needed.
Share:
/facilities/counselling-center

Yoga & Meditation
Admission Enquiry
YOGA & MEDITATION
Yoga & Meditation:
DEPARTMENT OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION
CENTRE FOR YOGA AND MEDITATION
– SHIVA SAGAR MEDITATION HALL - DSI
YOGA INSTRUCTOR: Dr. Sudhindra
[ P.G. Diploma in Yoga & M.Sc in Yogic Science from Annamalai University, B.NAT (Bachelor of Naturopathy @ Yogic Science Degree) from Madras University., B.A.M.S (Bachelor of Alternative Medicines) from Calcutta University. A certified yoga teacher from Adi Shankara Yoga Kendra]
Dr. Sudhindra -
is a Yoga Therapist. He joined  Dayananda Sagar Institutions(DSI)  in the year 2018 as Yoga instructor / Mentor to train the Teaching Faculty, Staff & Students of DSI.
Dr. Sudhindra, introduces Yoga and Meditation techniques to the newly joined students of both DSI and Dayananda Sagar University (DSU). His commitment also extends in conducting regular training sessions for the faculty members and the staff of DSI and DSU at the Meditation Centre, DSCE, Kumaraswamy Layout, Bangalore.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, he has conducted many online sessions on YOGA & Meditation for the benefit of students as well as
staff.

Scholarships
Home

FACILITIES
>
Scholarships
Admission Enquiry
Scholarships Details
DAYANAND SAGAR COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING, BANGALORE - 560 111
VARIES TYPES OF SCHOLASHIPS
SL NO
TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP
SPONSORSHIP
ELIGIBILITY
PROCEDURE TO APPLY
1
AIC-DSU Foundation - Scholarships: Research Scholars & Scientific Officers
NITI Aayog, Government of India and Dayananda Sagar University, Bengaluru and support by the Innovation Labs established with assistance from MNCs
Young achievers with a master’s degree in Science/Engineering and desirous of working on a doctoral program leading to the award of a PhD are invited to apply to the position of: Research Scholars & Scientific Officers. Candidates with research/ industry experience would find preference.
For more details:
Click Here
2
Post Matric Scholarships Scheme for Minorities
MINISTRY OF MINORITY AFFARIS GOI
Students belonging to six notified minority communities viz. Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi (Zoroastrian) studying in India and fulfilling the Scheme guidelines are eligible to apply for these scholarships.
For more details visit NSP (NATIONAL SCHOLARSHIP PORTAL) wibsite
Apply through NATIONAL SCHOLARSHIP PORTAL
3
Merit Cum Means Scholarship For Professional and Technical Courses CS
4
Post-matric Scholarship for Students with Disabilities
DAPARTMENT OF EMPOWERMENT OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES
The students with the specified disabilities defined in schedule of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act.2016 will be eligible for the scholarships
5
Scholarships for Top Class Education for students with disabilities.
6
Financial Assistance for Education of the Wards of Beedi/Cine/IOMC/LSDM Workers - Post-Matric
MINISTRY OF LABOUR & EMPLOYMENT. GOI
Parents of the students should be Beedi, Iron Ore Manganese & Chrome Ore Mines, Limestone & Dolomite Mines, Cine worker with atleast six months service,includes Contract/Gharkhataworkers .
7
CENTRAL SECTOR SCHEME OF SCHOLARSHIPS FOR COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY STUDENTS
DEPARTMENT OF HIGHER EDUCATION.GOI
Students who are above 80th percentile of successful candidates in the relevant stream from the respective Board of Examination in Class XII of 10+2 pattern or equivalent and pursuing regular courses and not availing benefit of any other scholarship scheme including State run scholarship schemes
8
Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme For Central Armed Police Forces And Assam Rifles
WARB,MINISTRY OF HOME OFFAIRS
Wards/widows of deceased CAPFs & AR personal died in harness/clection duty, wards of personal disabled due to causes attributable to govt. service and ward of Ex-CRPFs & AR personnel in receipt of Gallantry Awards. Dependent wards of State Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks
9
PRIME MINISTER'S SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME FOR WARDS OF STATES/UTs POLICE PERSONNEL MARTYRED DURING TERROR/NAXAL ATTACKS
10
Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme For RPF/RPSF
RPF/RPSF,MANISTRY OF RAILWAY
11
FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE STUDENTS OF NER FOR HIGHER PROFESSIONAL COURSES(NEC MERIT SCHOLARSHIP)
NORTH EASTERN COUNCIAL,DoNER
PRAGATI SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME FOR GIRL STUDENTS ( TECHNICAL DEGREE)
ALL INDIA COUNCIL FOR TECHNICAL EDUCATION(AICTE)
Maximum two girl child per family. Family income from all sources should not be more than Rs. 8 lakh per annum.
SAKSHAM SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME FOR SPECIALLY ABLED STUDENT ( TECHNICAL DEGREE)
Specially-abled student, having disability of not less than 40%. Family income from all sources should not be more than Rs. 8 lakh per annum.
12
E-PASS/KAREPASS
DEPT OF BACKWARD CLASS WELFARE,GOK
OBC
Parental Annual Income below 1 lakh
For more details visit SSP (STATE SCHOLARSHIP PORTAL) wibsite
For more details visit SSP (STATE SCHOLARSHIP PORTAL) wibsite
CATEGORY-I
Parental Annual Income below 2.5 lakhs
13
POST MATRIC SCHOLARSHIP FOR SC/ST STUDENTS
DEPT OF SOCIAL WELFARE,GOK
Parental Annual Income below 2.5 lakhs
Parental Annual Income Between 2.5 to 10.00 lakhs
EDUCATION ASSISTANCE TO CHILDRAN OF THE ORGANISED WORKERS
DEPT OF LABOUR. GOK
50% MARKS - FOR GENARAL 45% MARKS - FOR SC/ST
klwbapps.karnataka.gov.in
14
JINDAL SCHOLARSHIP
SITARAM JINDAL FOUNDATION
For more details visit JINDAL wibsite
Application download from Jindal wibsite & submit the same to jindal foundation office after the signature from the head of the institute alongwith necessery docuements
15
DHARMSTHALA KSHEMABIRUDDI SANGA
DHARMSTHALA KSHEMABIRUDDI SANGA
Collection & submission of the Application at DHARMASTHALA KSHMABIRUDDI SANGA office after the signature from the Head of the Institute alongwith necessery docuements
16
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE CHILDREN OF TEACHERS
TEACHRS BENIFIT FUND
For more details contact BLOCK EDUCATION OFFICER of Concerned Tuluk
Collection & submission of the Application at TEACHRS BENEFIT FUND {TALUK BEO OFFICE} after the signature from the Head of the Institute alongwith necessery docuements

Life Skills
Admission Enquiry
Life Skills
ABOUT
Student Centric
Faculty Development Program
Gallery
In everyday life, the development of Life Skills helps an individual to find new ways of thinking & problem solving. Recognise the impact of their actions & teaches them to take responsibility for what they do rather than blame others. Build confidence both in spoken skills & for group Collaboration & Cooperation
Sushma Lingraj
Student Counsellor,
Life Coach, Motivational Speaker, DSI

DSCE clubs
A REPORT ON DRISHYAM DSCE PHOTOGRAPHY CLUB ONLINE WORKSHOP ON “ART OF BEING A PHOTOGRAPHER”
Date: 30 July 2020, 11 am
Program: Online workshop on “Art of being a Photographer”
Venue: Department of Physics, DSCE
PHOTOGRAPHY EXHIBITION
Date         :
12-14 October 2017
Program  :
Photography Exhibition
Venue      :
Premachandra Sagar auditorium, DSI.
A photography exhibition was conducted on 12-14 October 2017 during Vibrations 2017 by the Photographic club, DSCE. Many students participated in displaying their photographs in the auditorium. Student coordinators under the leadership of Abhishek Agarwal made the exhibition successful with the prints displayed. Principal Dr. C.P.S. Prakash and Vice Principals Dr. Ramesh Babu and Dr. Ramakrishna visited the exhibition and appreciated for conducting such an elegant exhibition and also extended their whole hearted support to the future activities of the Photographic club. Many faculties and students visited this exhibition and made it a success. This exhibition was coordinated by Mrs. Aruna P, Asst Professor, Physics department with guidance of Dr. C. M. Joseph, HOD of Physics, DSCE.
Principal Dr. C.P.S. Prakash declared the prizes for the online photographic competition held for first semester and higher semester students.
WORKSHOP ON PHOTOGRAPHY 2.0
Date           :
16 September 2017.
Time          :
1.30 -3 PM.
Program   :
Photography workshop 2.0.
Venue :
BB 301
Photography club has conducted its second workshop on photography on 16th September 2017 for around 30 students. The workshop was held by a senior student Mr. Abhishek in which he spoke about a photograph as a STORY with THREE ACT NARRATIVE.
His discussion was on how one can control that narrative via FRAMING. He covered various topics like Golden Ratio, Guiding Lines, Positive: Negative Space, Foreground: How it creates a sense of depth in Landscape and Tilting.
Click here for the complete report ...
WORKSHOP ON PHOTOGRAPHY 1.0
Date           :
12 September 2017.
Time          :
3.30 -5 PM
Program   :
Photography workshop 1.0.
Venue       :
AV auditorium, DSI.
Physics department has initiated a photography club for first year engineering students who have passion for photography. DSCE Photography club has more than 100 participants along with few senior students. This club has conducted a workshop on photography on 12th September 2017.
Click here for the complete report ...

Nature club

Nature Club
NATURE CLUB DSI
Tree Plantation
Date:
29-07-2023
Program:
The Tree Plantation -MeriLiFE (Massive Tree Plantation Drive 2023) drive under AICTE
The Management of Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bangalore has always extended its support in encouraging its students to get involved in Green development and Eco-environmental activities .In this direction, our nature club is being one of the student bodies in the campus working towards saving our mother nature.
Click here to see more...
Community Volunteering Day
Date:
20-09-22
Program:
Community volunteering day @DSCE
This session was a unique exposure for the budding engineers to play their part of social involvement. Around 100 students from different branches of engineering departments. The activities were designed to cover volunteering qualities to other nature lovers.
Click here to see more...
Field Visit to “Swachagraha Kalika Kendra”,HSR Layout, Bengaluru on 16-09-2022
Date:
16-09-2022
Program:
Field visit to “Swachagraha Kalika Kendra”,HSR Layout, Bengaluru on 16-09-2022
The field visit to Swacha graha kalika kendra was planned to imbibe the responsibility of a citizen to take initiation towards cleaner and safer environment. The students were asked to register for the field visit at the departments of various branches of engineering.
Click here to see more...
Yoga for Beginners
Date:
19-8-2022
Program:
Yoga for beginners
In line with our club’s motto to bring humans close to nature , the next activity planned was the a wellness program : “Yoga for beginners”. In today's lifestyle due to long working hours on a desk could not only hurt our spine but also make us feel tired at the end of the day.So this activity was designed to our students to get started with this mind-body practice sessions.
Click here to see more...
Beginner’s Guide to Terrace Gardening
Date:
23-07-2022
Program:
Beginner’s Guide to Terrace Gardening
“Terrace gardening and kitchen gardening was organized by Nature club Prakuthi, DSCE ( Department of Physics and Civil Engineering)in association with SPICES project (AICTE) for the students on 23- 07-2022 at 9.00 AM at DSCE campus for the club members.
Click here to see more...
Rangoli Competition
Date:
02-07-2022
Program:
Rangoli Competition
The theme of the rangoli competition is “Save water”, this contest helps bring attention to how important water is to all living things on the planet. The contest is designed to encourage our young artists to express their own ideas, in relation to the chosen theme.
Click here to see more...
One Day Field Trip to Geenmagic Farm, Kanakapura
Date:
18-6-2022
Program:
One Day Field Trip to Geenmagic Farm, Kanakapura
A one day field trip to Geenmagic farm, Kanakapura through Prakruthi Nature Club, DSCE (organized by the Departments of Physics and Civil Engineering) under SPICES (AICTE) program was conducted on 18.6.2022.
Click here to see more...
World Earth Day Celebrations 2022
Date:
23-04-2022
Program:
World Earth Day Celebrations 2022
World Earth Day was celebrated at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering on 23rd April 2022 through our Nature club Prakruthi in association with ISHA foundation, Bengaluru. Dr. C.P.S. Prakash, Principal hosted the event by a tree plantation. Mr. Vishnu Nidhin, ISHA volunteer addressed the students and faculty about the Save Soil Movement and explained the responsibilities of each one to save the mother earth. All the students and faculty supported the Save Soil Movement.
Click here to see more...
Painting Competition
Date:
8th April 2022
Program:
Painting Competition
Nature is made of everything we see around us – trees, flowers, plants, animals, sky, mountains, forests and more. Human beings depend on nature to stay alive. Nature helps us breathe, gives us food, water, shelter, medicines, and clothes.
Click here to see more...
Orientation Program on Organic Gardening
Date:
24-11-2021, 22-02-2022
Program:
Orientation Program on Organic Gardening
Under Prakruthi-Nature club DSCE in association with AICTE-SPICES three dry compost pits were installed on 24-11-2021 inside DSCE campus behind the IEM engineering block. Mr. Yadunandan gave a demo to our club members about the complete life cycle of dry leaf turning into compost which can be used as manure for organic farming.
Click here to see more...
“Environmental Reasons to Switch to a Safe and Hygienic Personal Care”
Date:
28-09-2021
Program:
“Environmental Reasons to Switch to a Safe and Hygienic Personal Care”
Prakruthi-Nature club, DSCE is a student centric club which is first of its kind initiated in the campus towards saving our Mother Nature, started by Department of Physics and supported by management DSCE the club mainly aims at our contribution to a safer and cleaner environment in and around our campus.
Click here to see more...
A REPORT ON THE INVITED TALK ON “Technology: Aid to Municipal Solid Waste Management”
Date:
25 Nov 2020, 10 am
Program:
Online invited talk on “Technology: Aid to Municipal Solid Waste Management”
Speaker:
Mrs. Soumya Pattar (Coordinator, Samashti (NGO), Bangalore).
Organizers:
Nature Club, Department of Physics, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering
Prakruthi-Nature club, DSCE is a student centric club which is first of its kind initiated in the campus towards saving our Mother Nature, started by Department of Physics, DSCE mainly aiming at our contribution to a nature friendly DSI campus at a small scale and extending to the nearby places within the surrounding of the college at a large scale. To meet the mission of the club, every semester many activities are organized under club such as Plantation programs, Field trips, talks by subject experts on issues like challenges in maintaining cleaner and safer environment, solid waste management, Kitchen gardening, Terrace gardening, Composting are few of the topics to name. This webinar on “Technology: Aid to Municipal Solid Waste Management” was organized on 24th of November 2020, on Zoom platform.
Click here to see more...
Nature club Workshop on Kitchen Gardening
Date         :
11-03-2019
Program  :
Report on Nature club workshop on Kitchen gardening
“Prakruthi” the nature club of DSCE with objectives to plant trees in and around the college campus, to achieve cleaner and greener campus by educating the society about managing kitchen waste, to get attached with government/private centers working for the betterment of nature ,to educate the youths about their roles and contributions for meeting the aims of the club, conducted a workshop on “Kitchen and terrace gardening for safe and balanced environment” on 11-03-19 by Mr.Vishwanath P D (Officer, Horticulture department, Lalbagh, Bangalore). The program started with a welcome address by Dr.Priya Hoskeri (faculty coordinator).Then the speaker gave a vast information on how to utilize the available space at our premises and turn the space in to small in/out door gardens. This gave the audience an idea to manage available space and come up with a personalized garden which requires less space, easy to maintained greenery that gives satisfaction of being one with our mother nature. Further the speaker highlighted about how to set up a terrace garden and types of plants that can be selected to suite our kitchen and medicinal requirements which are free from huge amount of pesticides. The speaker showed the different methods of setting up terrace gardening and highlighted on after-care procedure to maintain the garden. As a tradition followed by the club a sapling plantation was also done by speaker along-with our Principal Dr C P S Prakash, Vice Principal Dr. H Ramakrishna and Dr. C M Joseph, HOD Physics. A pledge was then sworn by all the participants and a vote of thanks was given by the student representative Mr Kiran, Around 80 students witnessed the event gaining the knowledge on the topic. Few glimpses of the events were captured by Mr. Suhas M and Mr.Saurabh Singh.
Click here to see more...
One day training on ‘Terrace gardening” by Nature club
Date         :
24-03-2018
Program  :
One day training on ‘Terrace gardening” by Nature club
Venue      :
Horticulture training center, DSCE.
A one day training on Terrace gardening on behalf of Prakruthi, Nature club, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering was conducted on 24-03-2018 (Saturday) in Horticulture training center, Bangalore. Members of the club were the participants along with faculty coordinator Dr. Priya Hoskeri and Dr. Naveen S M. The session was on ‘Terrace gardening’ by Mr. Vishwanath, organic certification Inspector of the horticulture department. The session started with the registration procedure and then a small introduction to the horticulture department was given by the authorities and a basic information on what is the need for terrace gardening and how to proceed with it and to set up and maintain were highlighted. The information given in the introduction part mentioned that for terrace gardening most of the sun loving trees need at least 8 hours of direct sun light and shade loving trees need varied degrees of less intense light (shade), the plants also need good and deep soil.
The basic steps to set up terrace gardening were demonstrated and a visual tour was scheduled for a real time understanding of the concept. The members of the club were enlightened with the knowledge gained during the session. Students and faculty coordinators sincerely thank our HOD, Vice principal, Principal and the Management for facilitating us to attend the training programme.
Inauguration of the NATURE CLUB
INVITATION
Nature Club Prakruthi was inaugurated by
Dr. C P S Prakash
and Vice Principal
Dr. Ramesh Babu D R
along with
Dr. C M Joseph, HOD Physics
and Dr. Priya A H, faculty coordinator. Principal mentioned the importance of the Nature Club in such a vast campus and expressed his support to all the activities to be conducted in the near future. .
Our nature club is first of its kind initiated in the campus towards saving our mother nature.Started by Department of Physics, DSCE mainly aims at our contribution to a nature friendly DSI campus at a small scale and extending to near by places within the surrouding in and around the college at a large scale.Our nature club was consituted with first year students as club members and aims at improving the diversity of plant life at our campus.The thought of coming up with the club specifically aiming at saving nature started with the selection of committee members and defining the aims and objectives of the club

Aeronautical Society of India

Aeronautical Society of India
Admission Enquiry
AERONAUTICAL SOCIETY OF INDIA(AESI)
DEPARTMENT OF AERONAUTICAL ENGINEERING
Name of the Professional Body:
Aeronautical Society of India(AeSI)
Inaugurated by :
Chief Guest Shri V BALAKRISHNAN , Vice Chairman, AeSI, CEO, MTAL & Former Executive Director, HAL
ABOUT AeSI
AeSI is founded on December 27, 1948
Aims and Scope of the Journal of Aerospace Sciences and Technologies are intended to reflect the objective of the Aeronautical Society of India. The objective of the Society is to promote the advancement and dissemination of the knowledge of aeronautical sciences and aircraft engineering as well as elevation of the aeronautical profession.
Over the years, the Society has grown into a major professional body in the field of aeronautics, aviation & aerospace. The Society has 16 branches at all the important centers of aviation in the counter viz. Agra, Bangalore, Kolkata, Chandigarh, Chennai, Goa, Hyderabad, Kanpur, Kochi, Mumbai, Nasik, Nagpur, Pune, New Delhi, Sunabeda & Trivuvananthapuram. Society also has Journal Division and CFD Division at Bangalore.
Its membership of more than 9,000/- is drawn from all major Aeronautical establishments such as Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. D.G.C.A., Defence Research and Development Establishments, Academic Institutions, Aeronautical Development Agency, Indian Air Force, Indian Space Research Oganization, Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre, National Airports Autority of India, Air India, Indian Airlines, Jetways, Pawan Hans, Aero Industry in Private Sector. Private Airlines, Defence Res. & Dev. Laboratory, Army Aviation Corps. The Society also drives its strength from financial support and active participation of its Corporate Members. The society has 53 Corporate Members from both National and International Sectors.
ACTIVITIES OF THE SOCIETY
Fraternisation amongst professionals.
Enrols individuals, Institutions & Industries are members.
Conducts examinations in aeronautical engineering equivalent to a degree from an Indian University.
Publishes a Quarterly International Journal & monthly E-news.
Encourages Indian authors to write books on aeronautical/aerospace subjects.
Encourages young professionals to participate in International Conferences.
Confers Awards of Excellance.
Conducts Annual Essay Competitions for Students/Scientists/Engineers.
Provides a platform for Industry - R&D - Academic interaction.
Participates with the Government in the formulation of policies, procedures and guidelines.
Objectives of AeSI – Aero Club Student Chapter
About 120 students registered their names for student member in Aeronautical Society of India(AeSI).
The objectives of the AeSI – Aero Club student chapter are as follows:
To interact with the Engineers and Scientists from the Premier Institutes, R&D establishments and Industries who are Members and Fellow Members of the Aeronautical Society of India(AeSI).
In the department level, to arrange invited expert lectures, seminars, workshops and FDP programs.
To arrange industrial visits with the support of AeSI.
To encourage the students to participate in the technical events conducted at AeSI campus and other organizations conducted in association with AeSI..

National Service Scheme (NSS)
Home
>
Activities
>
National Service Scheme (NSS)
Admission Enquiry
National Service Scheme (NSS)
Blood Donation Camp
The Department of ISE& NSS -DSCE organized a Blood Donation Camp on 5th December 2025 at the Department of ISE, DSCE, Bengaluru, in collaboration with Sagar Hospitals. The event aimed to encourage voluntary blood donation and raise awareness about its life-saving importance. Students, faculty, and volunteers actively participated in the camp, contributing to a noble cause and reinforcing the values of social responsibility and community service.
See More...
Plantation at Govt. School
The Department of Bio Technology &Chemical Engineering, in association with the National Service Scheme (NSS)DSCE wing organized a tree plantation drive on 29th September 2025 at Kempegowda Government Higher Primary School, Kumaraswamy Layout, Bengaluru. The Department of Biotechnology also joined in support of this green initiative, which aimed to foster environmental awareness and promote sustainable practices among students. The program reflected the collective commitment of the departments to extend classroom learning into meaningful community engagement and environmental stewardship.
See More...
Awareness programme on CO-Existence,Zonotic Diseases & Animal Behaviour
Shree Keerthikumar, Kannada Film actor, Runner of Big Boss reality show on Zee Kannada Channel and Shree Channappa Huddar, Kannada Film Actor, Winner of Sa Re Ga Ma, Music champion show on Zee Kannda, were Chief Guests for the Program and the program was started with procession in the college premises along with chief guests followed by flag hoisting. Various competitions were conducted prior to the day of celebration viz. debate, quiz, singing etc. The Rajyothsava program was conducted at Dr. Premachandra Sagar Auditorium. The program started with inauguration followed by speeches by Chief Guest’s, Principal and Secretary. Various cultural programs were conducted and the event was concluded by valedictory program.
See More...
Nasha Muktha Bharat Pledge taking Activity
As part of the Nasha Muktha Bharat Abhiyaan, on 14th Aug 2025, Dr. Deepa H A, the NSS Department Coordinator, Department of Chemical Engineering, DSCE, organized a pledge-taking activity involving 7th semester students of the department. The pledge was undertaken to create awareness about the harmful effects of drug abuse and to educate the youth on the importance of staying away from addictive substances.
See More...
Har Ghar Tiranga Campaign
The Har Ghar Tiranga(Tricolour in Every Home) campaign, launched by the Indian government under Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, encourages every Indian to hoist the national flag at their homes from August 13-15 to foster patriotism and a personal connection with the flag, transforming it from a formal symbol to a heartfelt emblem of unity and national pride, with participation from citizens, organizations, and e-commerce platforms to ensure widespread celebration.
See More...
7 Days Special Camp
The Function was inaugurated by Sri Shivamada Naik, Punchayath Development officer Chiloor Grama Panchayath, NSS Program officers and NSS Volunteer Team DSCE by Lighting the Lamp. Initial visit was to the Government Lower Primary School, Road Jakkasandra. NSS volunteers conducted activities and games to engage the students. Panchayat and NSS representatives spoke about the importance of education in a person’s life, and encouraged the students to pursue their ambitions.
See More...
Essential Health and Hygiene Practices
The objective of the program was to educate and raise awareness about essential health and hygiene practices, the importance of a balanced diet, and preventive healthcare measures to ensure overall well- being.
See More...
Waste Management Awareness and Action Drive
The primary objective of the Waste Management Awareness Rally was to educate the public on the importance of proper waste management practices such as segregation, recycling, and composting.
See More...

Social Responsibility Cell
Home
>
Activities
>
Social Responsibility Cell
Admission Enquiry
Mudita
About
Our Events
Team Coordinator
Gallery
“MUDITA”, a term originating from Sanskrit embodies the profound joy derived from witnessing the happiness and well-being of others. Team Mudita, the OFFICIAL SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY CELL of Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, is committed to helping those in need. The team's fundamental goal is to cultivate a society where smiles abound, spreading joy across the populace. Team Mudita also focuses on highlighting the significance and awareness of core values and basic ethics in life. Among the forum's key objectives are empowering and engaging with the less fortunate and underprivileged, and fostering meaningful and enduring connections within the community.</br > Team Mudita's modest steps towards societal betterment aim to spark significant change and bring hope to many disheartened lives. Be it offering recreational breaks for senior citizens, organizing fests for college housekeeping staff, conducting career guidance programs and interactive learning sessions for underprivileged children, or collecting and distributing essential commodities to those in dire need, Team Mudita is dedicated to making a difference. With unwavering commitment, Team Mudita strives to uplift and transform lives. Together, we grow.
Vision
To socialize and spread happiness among people who are in dire need.
To create a pleasant atmosphere and spread optimistic vibes.
To help and support those in need.
To uplift the underprivileged classes of society.
Collaborations of Team Mudita
Team Mudita has teamed up with various organizations to boost community well-being. Through our partnership with Sahas NGO at the Lalbagh Flower Show, Team Mudita made sure the event space was kept clean. With Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), Team Mudita managed the Kadlekayi Parishe event in Basavannagudi, checking vendor setups and keeping the area clean. Team Mudita collaborated with Oracle to distribute beds collected from college to slums in Anjanapura. Once again, Team Mudita collaborated with Oracle to organize a poster design event at Nirmala Vidyalaya for Global Handwash Day to promote cleanliness and hygiene. Team Mudita also conducted a football event for underprivileged government school students at Saint Joseph High School grounds. Moreover, Team Mudita worked with Oracle volunteers, members of the Being Social NGO, and Rotary Bangalore Lakeside on a school painting project at the Act of Hope School, brightening up the school walls. These efforts show Team Mudita's dedication to supporting and improving local communities through effective teamwork and service.
Media Outreach
On the month of June 2022, Mudita got featured on "This Week India News", a news platform which showcased our event "Valuable Vintage" where we visit old age homes.
Amhiti
"Amhiti: Where Hope Found a Helping Hand"
This event was designed to bring the Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering together every year for three days to collect essential items and donations which include bedsheets, toiletries, packed food, stationery, clothes, school supplies, toys, pet food, sports equipment, and more, to extend a helping hand to those facing challenging circumstances and offer them a glimmer of hope for a brighter future. Amhiti as an event was a living example of this: Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give. An event like this reinstates our belief that when we come together as a community, we can create positive change. Even the smallest of contributions will make a difference in the lives of those in need and bring joy to their lives. The love that poured in during Amhiti has strengthened our resolve to serve the community.
Read more
Vihaanam
"Vihaanam" is an event that provides a college tour for students from government schools. It aims to introduce students to various branches of engineering and technology through guided tours of different departments, demonstrations of experiments by faculty members, and interactive sessions. The event fosters curiosity and provides an insightful overview of different engineering and science fields. Various games are played to keep the students refreshed. Conducting these tours allows the students to socialize, have fun, discuss their experiences with their peers, and explore the campus. By exposing students to real-world applications and academic environments, the event aims to motivate them to consider careers in science and engineering, broadening their horizons and aspirations.
Read more
Kritagnya
Kritagnya is an annual cultural fest organized by Team Mudita, dedicated to honoring and expressing gratitude to the non-teaching staff. This event aims to acknowledge the invaluable contributions of individuals such as housekeeping personnel, gardeners, and watchmen, offering them a refreshing break from their routine work. Through Kritagnya, Team Mudita seeks to recognize and celebrate the hard work and dedication of these essential members of our college community.
Read more
JoyFul Learning
Joyful Learning is a program that provides underprivileged children with a strong foundation-level education and moral values. Team Mudita focus on academic concepts, extracurricular activities, and real-time skills, including sensitive topics like women's health and hygiene. The team’s interactive games and activities make learning a fun experience. Team Mudita has taught construction workers' children, organized summer camps. Team Mudita’s goal is to transform these young children into aspiring youths who contribute to society's betterment.
Read more
Valuable Vintage
Valuable Vintage is one of Team Mudita's most consistent events. Through this initiative, Team Mudita visits various old age homes and aims to engage the elderly in fun and interactive activities. By bridging the generation gap, Team Mudita strives to bring out the inner child in them, celebrating their supportiveness and encouraging them to enjoy every moment. Team Mudita creates a joyful atmosphere with cultural events like singing, dancing, and playing games. At Valuable Vintage, Team Mudita believes in the power of laughter and shared experiences to brighten the lives of our elders, making each event a memorable and heartwarming experience. The positive response Team Mudita has received motivates us to continuously strive to conduct more events
Read more
Outstation Events
Team Mudita's outstation events are dedicated to, bringing joy, comfort, and essential resources to those in need. With a vision of including inclusivity and creating cherished memories, the team visits old age homes and orphanages in Gangavathi, Kolar, and Sindhanur, engaging with the residents through games, performances, and recreational activities. Donations of clothes and books collected in Amhiti are distributed during these visits. Team Mudita has organized impactful events in these locations. In Gangavathi, Team Mudita bonded with children at the ARD Campus and brought joy to the elderly at Maranatha Old Age Home. In Kolar, the team held a lively event at Antarganga Vidya Samste, featuring games, song and dance performances, and fun activities. In Sindhanur, the team visited Karunya Old Age Home and Ashakirana Orphanage, interacting with residents and children through creative sessions and performances.
Read more
Other Events
On January 14, 2023, Team Mudita collaborated with Oracle to distribute 70 beds to needy children in Anjanapura, Bengaluru. Earlier, on January 8, 2023, Team Mudita volunteered at a football tournament for underprivileged students, assisting and distributing awards.  On October 2nd, 2024, Team Mudita, in collaboration with the NGO Let's Be The Change, successfully hosted the Mega Operation Repurpose Drive—a large-scale initiative focused on transforming waste into valuable resources. This event aimed to promote responsible waste management by encouraging the collection and recycling of materials such as plastic, clothes, e-waste, and more. With over 200 kg of dry waste collected, the drive emphasized the importance of waste segregation and sustainable practices. Through door-to-door campaigns and community outreach in Kumarswamy Layout, the event inspired local citizens to adopt conscious waste disposal habits, contributing meaningfully to environmental sustainability.
Read more

First Year  Coordinator’s Desk

First Year
>
First Year  Coordinator’s Desk
Admission Enquiry
First Year Coordinator's Desk
Dr. Radha Gupta
Professor & Head Mathematics
Dr. Radha Gupta, Professor & Head Mathematics at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, is currently the First Year Coordinator for Chemistry Cycle. She has more than 27 years of experience in academia and Industry, in the domains of research, teaching and administration.
Read more
Dr. Joseph C M
Professor & Head Physics
I am Dr. C M Joseph heading the Physics department with a PhD in Physics and a postdoc from a reputed Japanese University with a prestigious Japanese Government fellowship in Nanotechnology. My areas of interests include Thin films, Organic sensors, photodetectors, memory devices for electronic applications, flexible wearables, displays for OLED screens and Solar cells.
Read more

/first-year/fy-cd

Admission Enquiry
Key Contacts
In view of the Covid-19 pandemic & subsequent lockdown all over the country, DSCE is abiding by the directives issued by VTU/State Government. We have established a cell for handling student grievances related to examinations and academic activities during COVID-19 pandemic as indicated below. The coordinators mentioned below will respond to the student grievances regarding the Academic & Examination activities and suggest suitable information/solution to the grievances raised by the students between 9.00 A.M. to 5.00 P.M. except on holidays.

DC WEST
Admission Enquiry
Dr. Chandramma Sagar Center for Women Empowerment and Skills Training (DC - WEST)
Under the aegis of Dr. Chandramma Sagar Center for Women Entrepreneurship and Skills Training (DC-WEST), DSCE is conducting several activities for the empowerment of women.
Empowerment of women which helps them to take their own decisions by breaking all personal limitations of the society and family. Empowering women is to make them independent in all aspects from mind, thought, rights, decisions, etc by leaving all the social and family limitations. It is to bring equality in the society for both male and female in all areas.
DSCE has organized many events for the empowerment of women and still continues the same.
Events organized Under the aegis of DC - WEST
The Clothesline Project
The Clothesline Project
The department of MCA in collaboration with Durga India under aegis of WHGR Cell, DSCE and DCWEST conducted an awareness program on “The Clothesline project” to address the issue of violence against women at our campus on 8thDecember 2022. The students of MCA actively took part in organizing the event. They took up the initiative of spreading the awareness of the event amongst the other students of DSI.
Click here for complete report
Workshop on Sustainable Menstruation
Workshop on Sustainable Menstruation
A seminar was organized on ‘Sustainable Menstruation’for the students and staff of DSCE by Dr. Aarushi Kehar, Senior Manager Research, Sirona Hygiene Foundation at 11:00AM on Saturday, 18th December 2021. The seminar included introduction to complexity of addressing menstruation, its importance, best practices and clinical approaches. It brought the awareness amongst students regarding the importance of menstrual health & hygiene.
Click here for complete report
Webinar on “Menstrual Hygiene Session”
Webinar on “Menstrual Hygiene Session”
On Account of Women’s Day, Dept of MCA organized a webinar on “Menstrual Hygiene Session” as an activity of ‘Women’s Grievances and Redressal Cell’ under the aegis of DC-WEST for all DSI female students and faculty members. It was a collaborative session with UNICHARM INDIA and GLOBALHUNT foundation.
Click here for complete report
Report on International Women's Day
Report on International Women's Day
Department of Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics, DSCE, in association with IWSA, Bangalore Chapter, celebrated the 24th International women’s day under the aegis of Dr. Chandramma Sagar Center for Women Empowerment and Skills Training (DCWEST) on 21st March 2019 to honor womanhood and acknowledge all women in the world for making this world a better place for everyone to live in.
Click here for complete report
Report on Self Defense Workshop
Report on Self Defense Workshop
Date: 7th October 2017
Time: 10.30 AM
Venue: Dr. PC Auditorium Food Court.
DC-WEST in association with TechFest of IIT Bombay conducted Nirbhaya- a Self-Defense workshop for girl students of DSCE. The trainer for the event was Mr. Fawad Ullah Syed, a Karate Black Belt, International Gold Medalist and Dojo Instructor from World Funakoshi Shotokan Karate Organization. The event was organized by the Department of MCA.
More than 110 girl students attended the event. Dr. Poornima Nataraja, HOD, Department of MCA welcomed the Principal Dr. C P S Prakash, Vice-Principal Dr. D R Ramesh Babu, Mr. Fawad Ullah Syed and his team. The Principal addressed the students on the relevance of self-defense for girls in modern times, where mobility and independence of girls has to be complemented with basic knowledge of survival under adverse situations.
Click here for complete report
World Yoga Day Celebration
World Yoga Day Celebration
On
June 21, 2017
to mark the celebration of International Yoga Day, Department of Automobile Engineering, , Department of MCA, andDepartment of Mathematicsunder the banner of
DC-WEST
had invited
ISHA
foundation, Jayanagar, Bangalore for learning Upa Yoga formulated by his excellence Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev.
Principal Dr. C.P.S. Prakash presided over the celebration and participated in practicing and learning yoga along with Vice Principal
Dr. H. Ramakrishna
. HOD’s of various departments along with their faculty and instructors actively participated in the celebration from 10.15am to 12.30pm at
Seminar Hall
,
Heritage
Building
,
DSCE
.
CELEBRATION OF INTERNATIONAL WOMEN’S DAY - 2017
CELEBRATION OF INTERNATIONAL WOMEN’S DAY - 2017
DATE:
6.03.2017, 7.03.2017 , 8.03.2017
VENUE:
P. C. Sagar food court
The second year of celebrating International women’s day was organized through Dr.Chandramma Sagar Center for Women Empowerment and Skills Training between 6-8th March 2017. The event was a successful one with faculty across Dayanandasagar Institutions participating in the events.   The event was coordinated by the students of MCA and first year engineering. We take this opportunity to thank the management for supporting women centric activities and also Oriflame for sponsoring gifts for the winners.  M/S Oriflame also sponsored the visitors to their stall with a free facial and makeup orientation session.
On the first day, the following events were organised:
“Musical chair”
and
“I know it all”.
This included playing of tagline quizzes, logo quizzes, and guessing of audio clips along with musical chair.  The second day involved the following games:
“One minute game”
and
“Tuk Tuk”.
These were games that involved various activities such as rapid fires which awaited quick responses from the participants.
“Cooking without fire”
was held on the third day wherein the participants prepared a variety of mouth-watering dishes and this event was judged by our respected Vice-Principal and Director.
The oriflame gift hampers were then given away as prizes to the respective winners of all the events but the highlight of the event was
“the lucky draw winners”
by Oriflame. Overall the three-day women’s day celebration was a very highly spirited one and the participants as well as the organisers had a wonderful time.
Share:
